original: des na shes pa yod pa nyid sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur gzhan dag shes pa yod par bsgrub ba'i phyir smra ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na shes pa yod pa nyid sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur gzhan dag shes pa yod par bsgrub ba'i phyir smra ba ni dmigs par bya ba nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: In order to prove the existence of consciousness, the statement â€œThat which is the object of observation is observedâ€ is made.

original: dmigs pa po ni bdag yin la dmigs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa po ni bdag yin la dmigs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i bya ba ste /
translated: The observer is the self and that which is called the object of observation is the action of observation.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of consciousness is that.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te shes pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te shes pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise, if that called consciousness does not exist,

original: de'i tshe 'di gang gis dmigs zhes brgal zhing brtag pa na gal te don gyis go ba mi 'jug na de'i tshe lan nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di gang gis dmigs zhes brgal zhing brtag pa na gal te don gyis go ba mi 'jug na de'i tshe lan nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: then when it is argued and analyzed, â€œBy what is it observed?â€ if one does not understand the meaning of the statement, then at that time there is no reply at all.

original: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba gang @204b yin pa de gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshi gang gis dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba gang @204b yin pa de gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshi gang gis dmigs par byed de /
translated: If the object of observation by another is the reason, then by what is it observed?

original: ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not established is not suitable as a reason.

original: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba de yang gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba de yang gzhan gyis te /
translated: If that which is perceived by one is also perceived by another,

original: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan dag gis dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan dag gis dmigs pa yin na /
translated: then that which is perceived by another would have the characteristic of being perceived by one.

original: de lta yin na re zhig gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid ni shes pa'i rtags yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na re zhig gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid ni shes pa'i rtags yin la /
translated: If that were so, then first, being perceived by another would be a reason for consciousness.

original: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid de yang dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid de yang dmigs pa yin te /
translated: And that being perceived by another would also be perceived,

original: des na de la yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid yod de des na de la de rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de la yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid yod de des na de la de rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and therefore, it would also be perceived by another. Therefore, it would be inferred by that.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is â€œIn that case . . . â€

original: gtan tshigs de yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba yin la de yang gzhan gyis yin na thug pa med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de yang gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba yin la de yang gzhan gyis yin na thug pa med do //
translated: And that reason would be perceived by another, and that would be perceived by another.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni rang nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni rang nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the second conception, it is said, â€œIf one says that . . . â€

original: gzung ba la yang rang nyid dmigs par thal lo //
analyzed: gzung ba la yang rang nyid dmigs par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the object would also be perceived by itself.

original: ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa rang nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yang yin par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½'on te zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa rang nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yang yin par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to // 'on te zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that just as the apprehender is the nature of the object of observation, so too the object of observation is the nature of the apprehender.

original: gzhan la ltos pa gang yin pa de gzhan med par gzhan la ltos pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa gang yin pa de gzhan med par gzhan la ltos pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: â€œ Butâ€ introduces an objection: â€œIf it is dependent on another, how could it be dependent on another without that other?â€

original: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pa kho na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not dependent on another.

original: des na gal te gzhan la ltos par rig na de'i tshe gzhan yang yang rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te gzhan la ltos par rig na de'i tshe gzhan yang yang rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it is known to be dependent on another, then at that time the other is also known.

original: 'on te gzhan the tshom gyi yul yin pa de las gzhan la ltos pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan the tshom gyi yul yin pa de las gzhan la ltos pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the other is the object of doubt, then it is known to be dependent on another.

original: the tshom za na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom za na zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œ If there is doubtâ€ is stated.

original: gal te gzhan la ltos pa nyid the tshom za ba de lta na yang shes pa yod pa la gzhan la ltos pa nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam na gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos pa nyid ma nges pas na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la ltos pa nyid the tshom za ba de lta na yang shes pa yod pa la gzhan la ltos pa nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro snyam na gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos pa nyid ma nges pas na /
translated: But if you doubt that it depends on another, still, the fact that consciousness exists and depends on another is the reason.

original: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba shes pa yod par nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba shes pa yod par nges par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œin order to ascertainâ€ means in order to ascertain that consciousness exists.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin gnyis yod de bdag la ltos pa'i rig bya nyid do zhes khas blangs nas gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin gnyis yod de bdag la ltos pa'i rig bya nyid do zhes khas blangs nas gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that a pot, etc. have two natures, namely, the nature of being perceptible and the nature of depending on another, others say:

original: 'on te bdag ltos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag ltos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œBut if it depends on the self, etc.â€

original: 'di brjod pa ni de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod pa ni de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase â€œby that aloneâ€ refers to this statement.

original: gal te bum pa dang snam bu dang lus la sogs pa ni thams cad bdag rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa dang snam bu dang lus la sogs pa ni thams cad bdag rig pa yin na /
translated: If a pot, a cloth, a body, etc. are all perceptible by the self,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar nga ni zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar nga ni zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: then how could one say â€œI see with my eyes,â€ etc.?

original: gal te gzhi mthun dbang gis na //
analyzed: gal te gzhi mthun dbang gis na //
translated: â€œBut if it depends on a common locus, etc.â€

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'jig rten gyis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'jig rten gyis brjod pa ste /
translated: This is a statement by the world.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bka' drin @205a * //ğŸ”½gyis // zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bka' drin @205a * // gyis // zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: by the grace of the king.

original: bdag ni dkar sham bdag ni sngo bsangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni dkar sham bdag ni sngo bsangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: I am white, I am dark blue, and so on.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa ni gal te gang la gzhi mthun pa yod pa der gdon mi za bar gcig 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa ni gal te gang la gzhi mthun pa yod pa der gdon mi za bar gcig 'gyur na'o //
translated: Moreover, if there were a common locus for something, then it would certainly be one.

original: de med pas zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid med pas so //
analyzed: de med pas zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid med pas so //
translated: Since that does not exist, that is, since oneness does not exist,

original: du mar zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa med par ro //
analyzed: du mar zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa med par ro //
translated: many is without a common locus.

original: de'i tshe gzhi mthun pa gcig nyid dang / de med pa du ma'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhi mthun pa gcig nyid dang / de med pa du ma'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, a common locus would be established as oneness and as the opposite of that, as multiplicity.

original: de ltar ma gyur na ste ji skad brjod pa khas mi len na /ğŸ”½grub bya ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa las gcig nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur na ste ji skad brjod pa khas mi len na / grub bya ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa las gcig nyid ma yin la /
translated: If that is not the case, that is, if one does not accept what has been said,ğŸ”½then there is no probandum, that is, there is no oneness from a common locus.

original: gzhi mthun ba med ba las bzlog pa du ma nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi mthun ba med ba las bzlog pa du ma nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And the opposite of a common locus, multiplicity, is also not the case.

original: 'o na te gzhi mthun pa med pa las du ma nyid yod pa yin no zhes brgya la brjod par 'ongs pas de la brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya bas dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'o na te gzhi mthun pa med pa las du ma nyid yod pa yin no zhes brgya la brjod par 'ongs pas de la brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya bas dpe yin te /
translated: The example is stated by the words â€œjust as,â€

original: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means â€œin that way.â€

original: gal te tha dad pa med par mthong ba gcig gis sgra gcan gyi mgo zhes bya ba de bzhin mthun ma yin pas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i du ma nyid la gnod na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa med par mthong ba gcig gis sgra gcan gyi mgo zhes bya ba de bzhin mthun ma yin pas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i du ma nyid la gnod na /
translated: If the existence of multiplicity, which is established by the perception of difference, is refuted by the perception of nondifference, as in the case of RÄhuâ€™s head,

original: de'i tshe 'dir yang zhes bya ba bum pa dang snam bu dang lus la sogs pa la yang tha dad par lta bar sgro btags pa la gnod par byed pa dang rig pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir yang zhes bya ba bum pa dang snam bu dang lus la sogs pa la yang tha dad par lta bar sgro btags pa la gnod par byed pa dang rig pa yod pa yin no //
translated: then the superimposition of the view of difference in regard to such things as pots, cloth, and bodies is also refuted.

original: de las log par zhes bya bas tha mi dad par dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de las log par zhes bya bas tha mi dad par dmigs pas so //
translated: The words â€œfrom thatâ€ refer to the perception of nondifference.

original: sngon po dang lus dang bde ba la sogs pa dang / rig pa ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang lus dang bde ba la sogs pa dang / rig pa ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Blue, the body, pleasure, and so on are not said to be associated with difference, that is, they are not different.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa mthong ba med pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa mthong ba med pas so //
translated: â€œBy whatâ€ means that a common locus is not seen.

original: rig pa'i don ni skyes so zhes bya ba rnam ba 'dis gzhi mthun pa mthong ba med dam /
analyzed: rig pa'i don ni skyes so zhes bya ba rnam ba 'dis gzhi mthun pa mthong ba med dam /
translated: â€œThe meaning of cognition has arisenâ€ means that by this mode, a common locus is not seen.

original: ci ste yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ste yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it definitely exists.

original: rjes 'gro zhes bya pa ni lus sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rig par rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rjes 'gro zhes bya pa ni lus sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rig par rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: â€œFollowingâ€ means that cognition follows a blue, yellow, etc. body.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Blue, etc. are the opposite of those.

original: gal te don dam par tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par tha dad pa med na /

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par rtogs pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: how is there the understanding of following and turning away?

original: rjes 'gro ldog par rig pa ni //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog par rig pa ni // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The understanding of following and turning awayğŸ”½is not the same as the understanding of the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof of following and turning away is â€œform, etc.â€

analyzed: gzhan na yang zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan na lus med par yang gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'dis ni lus ldog pa dang sngon po la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro bar ston to //
translated: This shows that the body is excluded and that blue, etc. are included.

original: bdag kho nas sngon po dang ser po mthong ngo @205b zhes lhag par zhen pa las ni rjes su 'gro ba dang sngon po la sogs pa ni ldog pa yin no zhes kyang rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kho nas sngon po dang ser po mthong ngo @205b zhes lhag par zhen pa las ni rjes su 'gro ba dang sngon po la sogs pa ni ldog pa yin no zhes kyang rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: From the over-exclusive statement, I see blue and yellow, it is also to be understood that blue, etc. are excluded and that the body is included.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin rnams 'brel pa ste /
translated: The object, time, and nature are related.

original: de dag la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their certainty.

original: gal te rjes su 'go pa dang ldog pa dag kyang don dam par rig pa yin na de'i tshe rang nyid gnyis su med par ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na rjes su zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'go pa dang ldog pa dag kyang don dam par rig pa yin na de'i tshe rang nyid gnyis su med par ma yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na rjes su zhes gsungs so //
translated: If following and excluding are also known in the ultimate, then at that time it is understood that they are not non-dual by themselves.

analyzed: rjes 'gro dang zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa nyid kyang ngo //

analyzed: yang ji ltar na mngon sum gyis tha dad pa med pa nyid 'dzin snyam na /
translated: Again, how is non-difference apprehended by direct perception?

original: rang bzhin nyid ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni zhes gsungs te /

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin nyid rig pa yin pa de'i phyir na tha mi dad pa rig pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin nyid rig pa yin pa de'i phyir na tha mi dad pa rig pa yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is just the intrinsic reality itself that is the awareness, therefore it is the awareness of what is not different.

original: rig med ces bya ba ni ma rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rig med ces bya ba ni ma rtogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œNon-awarenessâ€ refers to non-understanding.

original: gal te ma rtogs pa la rtogs so zhes rlom par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma rtogs pa la rtogs so zhes rlom par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one were to think, â€œHow could one who does not understand think, â€˜I understandâ€™?â€

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: â€œSomeoneâ€ means â€œsomeone who is not a fool.â€ğŸ”½â€œIn this caseâ€ means that even in the case of the conceit â€œI see difference,â€ there is a reason for the superimposition of difference.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa mthong bar mngon par rlom pa la yang phyin ci log tu tha dad bar sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'du byed zad pa yin
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa mthong bar mngon par rlom pa la yang phyin ci log tu tha dad bar sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'du byed zad pa yin
translated: The reason for this conception is the exhaustion of conditioning factors.

original: no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa la brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //

original: dngos po de sngar ni mthong ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po de sngar ni mthong ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: That thing was not seen before.

original: gang gis 'du byed zad pa mthong bar mngon bar rlom pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba 'du byed de'i yul na du ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'du byed zad pa mthong bar mngon bar rlom pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba 'du byed de'i yul na du ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that object of compositional activity be the ground for the conceit â€œI see the cessation of compositional activityâ€?

original: de nyid brjod pa ni 'du byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni 'du byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to that is â€œThe compositional activity . . . .â€

original: 'o na de'i yul can gyi 'du byed kyang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i yul can gyi 'du byed kyang yod do zhe na /
translated: â€œBut doesnâ€™t the object of that compositional activity exist?â€

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe arising . . . .â€

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu mi 'thad pa ni bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mi 'thad pa ni bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The untenability of a cause of destruction has already been explained.

original: phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma mthong yang mthong bar mngon bar rlom pa'i'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma mthong yang mthong bar mngon bar rlom pa'i'o //
translated: â€œThe superimposition of errorâ€ is the conceit â€œI seeâ€ even though one does not see.

original: ga lter rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag don dam pa nyid yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ga lter rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag don dam pa nyid yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the presence and absence of the object of compositional activity were ultimate,

original: de'i tshe gang gis 'du byed zad pa rgyu mtshan du ma gyur pa ji ltar na 'di gnyis mngon par rlom pa tsam yin snyam na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang gis 'du byed zad pa rgyu mtshan du ma gyur pa ji ltar na 'di gnyis mngon par rlom pa tsam yin snyam na /
translated: then how could the cessation of compositional activity not be the ground for the conceit â€œI seeâ€? How could these two be mere conceit?

original: mngon par rlom pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is â€œFrom conceit . . . .â€

original: rnam par dben par gzung yang zhes sngon po dang ser po tshogs pa gang yin pa dang so so ba gang yin pa de gnyis so sor gzung yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dben par gzung yang zhes sngon po dang ser po tshogs pa gang yin pa dang so so ba gang yin pa de gnyis so sor gzung yang ngo //

analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni yan lag can mthong ba med na'o //
translated: then, in the absence of that, that is, in the absence of the perception of the whole,

analyzed: tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye bar gnas pa'i'o //
translated: the difference, that is, the separate existence,

analyzed: de'i phyir te bshad pa'i tshul du yan lag can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: of the parts is not apprehended, because of the absence of the whole, as has been explained.

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig nyid kyis so //ğŸ”½don dam par na 'dzin pa zhes @206a * //
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig nyid kyis so // don dam par na 'dzin pa zhes @206a * //
translated: In that case, that is, by means of a single cognition,

original: bya ba 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: bya ba 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
translated: ultimately, there is no apprehension at all.

original: don kyang blo de'i rnam par skye ba nyid de 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: don kyang blo de'i rnam par skye ba nyid de 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: However, the object is born in the form of that cognition, and so it is apprehended.

original: 'on te dngos po gcig kho nas blo skyed par byed kyi du mas ni ma yin te des na gcig gi 'dzin byed yin gyi du ma ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gcig kho nas blo skyed par byed kyi du mas ni ma yin te des na gcig gi 'dzin byed yin gyi du ma ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if a single entity alone generates the cognition, not many, then it is the apprehender of the one, not of the many.

original: du ma gcig gi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: du ma gcig gi zhes gsungs so //
translated: To this he says, â€œThe many of the one.â€

original: rang gi lugs la ltos pa'i dpe bstan nas gzhan gyi lugs la ltos pa yang brjod pa ni bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lugs la ltos pa'i dpe bstan nas gzhan gyi lugs la ltos pa yang brjod pa ni bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having taught the example in terms of oneâ€™s own system, he also mentions it in terms of the other system: â€œIf the self and the mind are one, etc.â€

original: gal te rdul phra rab mang po dag kyang rnam par shes pa gcig skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab mang po dag kyang rnam par shes pa gcig skyes pa yin na /
translated: If many atoms produce one consciousness,

original: de'i tshe ci 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ci 'gal ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then at that time there is no contradiction at all.

original: shes pa skyed pa 'dir rdul phra rab chen po nyid kyis ni khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa 'dir rdul phra rab chen po nyid kyis ni khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the production of consciousness is not distinguished by the largeness of the atom,

original: 'on kyang khyad par de ni nus pa phul du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par de ni nus pa phul du byung ba yin no //
translated: but rather that distinction is the excellence of its capacity.

original: gal te chen po nyid khyad par ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te chen po nyid khyad par ma yin na /
translated: If largeness is not a distinction,

original: de'i chen po ma yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chen po ma yin par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then its smallness would not be a distinction.

original: rdul phra rab gcig pu yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig pu yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: One single atom would also be apprehended.

original: nus pa med phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nus pa med phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, â€œBecause it lacks the capacity.â€

original: rdul phra rab gcig ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One single atom does not become a cause because it lacks the capacity to produce consciousness.

original: chen po min phyir zhes bya ba ni chen po ma yin pa'i rgyus na /
analyzed: chen po min phyir zhes bya ba ni chen po ma yin pa'i rgyus na /
translated: Because it is not great.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i gnas skabs na rgyur mi 'dod pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i gnas skabs na rgyur mi 'dod pa ni ma yin na /
translated: It is not that it is not accepted as a cause when it is in a state of isolation.

original: gang gis phra ba'i phyir tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang skyed byed ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis phra ba'i phyir tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang skyed byed ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: But because it is subtle, it would not be a producer even when it is in a state of aggregation.

original: rang gi tshig le'ur byas pa nyid bshad pa'i don du 'jug par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig le'ur byas pa nyid bshad pa'i don du 'jug par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word â€œifâ€ is used to introduce the explanation of the very verses of the opponent.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bltar rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bltar rung ba nyid do //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to visibility, which is defined as the capacity to generate a cognition that conforms to its essential nature.

original: sgra la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid 'chad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid 'chad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œBecause it is seen in sound, etc.â€ This is explained by the example.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa dag kho na soms shig gi dbyibs snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa dag kho na soms shig gi dbyibs snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: â€œIn the same wayâ€ means that the shape is not perceived separately, but is perceived as mixed with color. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: phra mo ste phra mo tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su de yang zhes bya ba de ltar yang ji ltar bskyed 'di la brjod pa ni yan 'gar ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phra mo ste phra mo tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su de yang zhes bya ba de ltar yang ji ltar bskyed 'di la brjod pa ni yan 'gar ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and subtle, i.e., the state of the collection of the subtle, that also, i.e., how is that generated? The reply here is â€œby the special ones.â€

original: sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra nyid phra mo nyid yin yang rgyu'i dngos po yin te nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na sgra nyid phra mo nyid yin yang rgyu'i dngos po yin te nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like sound itself, i.e., for example, sound itself is subtle, but it is the cause of the gross, because it has the capacity.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab dag la yang nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab dag la yang nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the atoms also have the capacity.

original: gzhan yang gal te rags pa nyid rgyu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rags pa nyid rgyu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if grossness is the reason for the cause of the causal entity, then the eye, etc., would not be.

original: dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig pa'i gnas skabs @206b las tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su rags pa nyid 'ga' zhig skyes pa na yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig pa'i gnas skabs @206b las tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su rags pa nyid 'ga' zhig skyes pa na yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that grossness is not produced in the state of the collection from the state of the mere sense faculties, the reply is â€œthe collection.â€

original: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni mtshungs pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni mtshungs pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another fault is stated: â€œIf there is sameness, . . .â€

original: mtshungs pa nyid ni nus pa thag ring po'i yul dang thag nye mo'i yul dag tu rtogs pa po la 'dra ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid ni nus pa thag ring po'i yul dang thag nye mo'i yul dag tu rtogs pa po la 'dra ba nyid yin na /
translated: Sameness is the sameness of the cognition of the object, whether it is distant or near.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni yul zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni yul zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here it is said: â€œThe object . . .â€

original: yul thag ring ba nyid kyis na lhan cig byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin la de las ni 'ga' zhig tu skye zhing 'ga' zhig tu ni mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yul thag ring ba nyid kyis na lhan cig byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin la de las ni 'ga' zhig tu skye zhing 'ga' zhig tu ni mi skye ba yin no //
translated: The object is distant or near because of the separation or nonseparation of the cooperating conditions. From that, it is produced in some cases and not produced in other cases.

original: rnam par dbye ba ga las 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ga las 'gyur //
translated: â€œHow can there be separation?â€

original: zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring bas ni mi skyed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring bas ni mi skyed la /
translated: That is, it is not produced because of the distance of the object.

original: thag nye bas ni skye ba'o zhes bya ba de lta'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: thag nye bas ni skye ba'o zhes bya ba de lta'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is produced because of the nearness of the object. Such is the characteristic.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni tshogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni tshogs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here it is said: â€œAnother collection . . .â€

original: thag nye ba ni tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams mig la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed par 'gyur pa yin la thag ring na ni mi 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: thag nye ba ni tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams mig la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed par 'gyur pa yin la thag ring na ni mi 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: Since other collections of atoms enter into proximity, the atoms become co-producing conditions of the eye, etc. But when they are distant, they do not.

original: tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan rjes su zhugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because other collections of atoms do not enter into proximity.

original: rtsod pa dang 'gal ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba nyid las rdul phra rab de rnams bltar rung ba ma yin yang nus pa rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lan rtogs par bla ba'i phyir ma brjod do //
analyzed: rtsod pa dang 'gal ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba nyid las rdul phra rab de rnams bltar rung ba ma yin yang nus pa rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i lan rtogs par bla ba'i phyir ma brjod do //
translated: The objection and the contradiction are not stated because it is easy to understand the answer: â€œThe atoms are not visible, but their power is inferred from the very seeing of the effect.â€

original: gzugs kyi skye mched du mtshungs pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa tsam ru'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched du mtshungs pas zhes bya ba ni sngon po'i rnam pa tsam ru'o //
translated: â€œBecause they are similar as form basesâ€ means that they are similar as mere blue aspects.

original: de brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIt is saidâ€ means â€œit is expressed.â€

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du don yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du don yod pa ma yin la /
translated: â€œElsewhereâ€ means that the external object does not exist.

original: de la yan lag can ni med pa des na gdon mi za bar sngon po'i rnam pa nyid snang ba na /
analyzed: de la yan lag can ni med pa des na gdon mi za bar sngon po'i rnam pa nyid snang ba na /
translated: Since the possessor of parts does not exist there, when the mere aspect of blue appears,

original: rdul phra rab rnams kho na yin par 'thad pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kho na yin par 'thad pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: It is reasonable that only the atoms are apprehended.

original: mi 'dzin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi yan lag rnams dang lhan cig mi 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'ba' zhig 'dzin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi yan lag rnams dang lhan cig mi 'dzin pa nyid kyis 'ba' zhig 'dzin no snyam pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is apprehended as a single unit because it is not apprehended together with its parts.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation.

original: de nyid dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gyur ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gyur ba dang ngo //
translated: The same is the case with the cow, etc.

original: cha ni yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: cha ni yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The parts are the limbs.

original: de dang ba lang gzung pa'i phyir yan lag rdzogs par mi 'dzin par thal lo //
analyzed: de dang ba lang gzung pa'i phyir yan lag rdzogs par mi 'dzin par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the complete limbs are not apprehended because the cow is apprehended.

original: thams cad bya ba ni yan lag mtha' dag go //
analyzed: thams cad bya ba ni yan lag mtha' dag go //
translated: The entire action is the complete limbs.

original: khyad par nyid gzhan dag gis khyad par tsam nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang khyad par nyid gzhan gyi tshe skyes bu de nyid kyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par nyid gzhan dag gis khyad par tsam nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang khyad par nyid gzhan gyi tshe skyes bu de nyid kyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference is understood as a mere difference from others and because the difference itself is understood as the difference of that person.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rnam @207a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rnam @207a * //
translated: The nature of things is not like that.

original: par mi gnas pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: par mi gnas pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the meaning is not different from the person,ğŸ”½because it follows that there would be no self if the meanings were different for each person.

original: don rnams skyes bu so so la tha dad na bdag med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnams skyes bu so so la tha dad na bdag med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because two thoughts cannot be tenable at the same time.

original: gal te khyad par dang khyad par can nyid dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang khyad par can nyid dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that since the difference and the bearer of the difference are apprehended by nonconceptual perception,

original: des na khyad par du ma dus gcig kho nar 'dzin par 'thad do snyam na rnam par rtog pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par du ma dus gcig kho nar 'dzin par 'thad do snyam na rnam par rtog pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is tenable that many differences are apprehended at the same time, then it is said that nonconceptual perception does not apprehend.

original: ba lang zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid dang ldan par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid dang ldan par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The so-called cow is the thing that is asserted to possess cowness.

original: de ni ba lang nyid dang mi ldan par rang nyid kyis ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ba lang nyid dang mi ldan par rang nyid kyis ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it does not possess cowness, nor is it itself not a cow.

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yin no //
translated: It is a cow because it possesses cowness.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same goes for the others.

original: tha dad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: â€œDifferentiationâ€ means distinction.

original: phyis ni zhes bya ba ni blo gcig 'og tu'o //
analyzed: phyis ni zhes bya ba ni blo gcig 'og tu'o //
translated: â€œLaterâ€ means after a single cognition.

original: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: â€œTheseâ€ refers to cowness, whiteness, etc.

original: tha dad par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid ni 'di'i tshogs yin la 'di'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid ni 'di'i tshogs yin la 'di'i ni ma yin no //
translated: â€œApplication of differentiationâ€ means that cowness is the collection of this, but not of that.

original: 'di ni dkar po 'di ni nag po yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas sbyor ba mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dkar po 'di ni nag po yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas sbyor ba mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œThis is white, that is blackâ€ â€” such differentiation and application would be impossible.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To clarify that very point, he says, â€œbecause of the impossibility of the application of differentiation.â€

original: tha dad par sbyar ba na zhes bya ba yul tha dad pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: tha dad par sbyar ba na zhes bya ba yul tha dad pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: â€œApplication of differentiationâ€ means with respect to different things due to different objects.

original: gcig gi yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzung ba'i rjes la de yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gi yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad gzung ba'i rjes la de yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: â€œOf oneâ€ means that after the apprehension of all, that is also apprehended.

original: du ma ni khyad par dang khyad par can no //
analyzed: du ma ni khyad par dang khyad par can no //
translated: â€œPluralityâ€ refers to the qualified and the qualifier.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa brjod zin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs sun 'byin pa brjod zin pa'i phyir na /
translated: The position of non-difference is refuted because there is no difference at all.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The position of non-difference is refuted because there is no difference at all.ğŸ”½The meaning is that since the one attribute is identical with it, everything is one.

original: des na du ma 'dzin par ji ltar thal snyam na de ma bzung bar ni @207b zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na du ma 'dzin par ji ltar thal snyam na de ma bzung bar ni @207b zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: â€œIf those were not apprehended.â€

original: de tsam rnams sam yon tan gsum ma bzung bar na'o //
analyzed: de tsam rnams sam yon tan gsum ma bzung bar na'o //
translated: If those, the mere three qualities, were not apprehended.

original: gal te de tsam la sogs pa rnams las sgra la sogs pa 'bras bu gzhan gcig nyid skye ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: gal te de tsam la sogs pa rnams las sgra la sogs pa 'bras bu gzhan gcig nyid skye ba ma yin nam //
translated: If from those, the mere three qualities, a single other effect, sound, etc., were not produced,

original: des na de gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na de gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: then how could it be apprehended?

original: 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: â€œThe other effect.â€

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bo las so //
translated: â€œFrom thatâ€ means from its own nature.

original: 'dir yang brgya la gtso bo dang phal pa'i dngos po du ma 'dzin par sgrar 'ongs pas de las brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang brgya la gtso bo dang phal pa'i dngos po du ma 'dzin par sgrar 'ongs pas de las brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, if many things were apprehended as sound, which is the primary thing,ğŸ”½then it is said: â€œThe remainder.â€

original: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba'o snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba'o snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œAs beforeâ€ means as previously stated:

original: cig car yan lag rdzogs 'dzin min //
analyzed: cig car yan lag rdzogs 'dzin min //
translated: â€œSimultaneously, the complete parts are not apprehended.â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod zin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod zin pa'o //
translated: The remainder is stated.

original: bsags pa dang ni tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: bsags pa dang ni tshogs pa yin //
translated: The collection and the aggregationğŸ”½are the general. The sense consciousnesses

original: de spyi de la dbang po'i blo //
analyzed: de spyi de la dbang po'i blo //
translated: are in that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa de bzlog nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa de bzlog nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the establishment of the subject as possessing the property of being imagined by others,

original: mjug sdud brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the conclusion is stated: â€œTherefore, . . .â€

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: â€œIfâ€ introduces a doubt.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis chos can mi 'dzin mod nyes pa ci yod snyam na chos can mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis chos can mi 'dzin mod nyes pa ci yod snyam na chos can mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, â€œIf direct perception does not apprehend the subject, what is the problem?,â€ [the response is:] â€œThe subject is not apprehended by direct perception. . . .â€

original: chos can grub pa me la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos can grub pa me la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The inference that proves fire, etc. will engage when the subject is established.

original: de lta ma yin na rtags thams cad rten ma grub pa'i nyes pas zin par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtags thams cad rten ma grub pa'i nyes pas zin par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: If that is not the case, then all reasons will be flawed because their basis is not established.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis chos can 'dzin par mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis chos can 'dzin par mi nus na /
translated: If direct perception is not able to apprehend the subject,

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas 'dzin la rag go snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas 'dzin la rag go snyam na /
translated: then it must be apprehended by inference.

original: chos can yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [The response is:] â€œThe subject . . .â€

original: 'o na mngon sum gyis chos can 'dzin no cog gi skyon snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyis chos can 'dzin no cog gi skyon snyam na /
translated: If it is asked, â€œWhat is the problem with direct perception apprehending the subject?,â€

original: chos can gzung ba ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: chos can gzung ba ni zhes smras so //
translated: [the response is:] â€œThe apprehension of the subject . . .â€

original: 'di la re zhig chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo bshad pa'i don du re zhig slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la re zhig chos kyi grags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo bshad pa'i don du re zhig slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo 'chad pa ni /
translated: Here, the master DharmakÄ«rti, in order to explain the meaning of the sÅ«tra, first states the position of the great master DignÄga.

original: chos can du ma'i zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½'on kyang rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa rig par bya ba dang byed pa pos zhes bya ba thun mong ma yin
analyzed: chos can du ma'i zhes bya ba'o // 'on kyang rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa rig par bya ba dang byed pa pos zhes bya ba thun mong ma yin
translated: â€œThe object of knowledge is many particulars.â€ğŸ”½â€œHowever, it is known by itselfâ€ means that a pot, etc., is known by its own uncommon nature, by that very nature.

original: pa rang nyid kyis shes pas rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa rang nyid kyis shes pas rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: â€œBy the knower and the agentâ€ means that it is known by itself, by the uncommon nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gzhi gcig pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag gzhi gcig pa nyid du ste /
translated: â€œThose forms, etc., are in one basisâ€ means that those forms, etc., are in one basis, in one thing.

original: chos can de la brten pa nyid du ni /
analyzed: chos can de la brten pa nyid du ni /
translated: â€œIn dependence on that basisâ€ means that they are in dependence on that basis.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œDirect perception does not realize themâ€ means that it does not realize them because it does not know them.

original: gzhan pa'i gzhi ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i gzhi ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: â€œAnother basis is not the domain of apprehensionâ€ is the connection.

original: de la brten pa ni gzhi @208a * //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni gzhi @208a * //
translated: The dependent is the basis of the imputation of the imagined.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: gzhan la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The form, etc. that are based on that are not the objects of the grasping of the eye, etc.ğŸ”½The word â€œonlyâ€ is to be supplied with both â€œseeingâ€ and â€œtouching.â€

original: gcig pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa dag go //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa dag go //
translated: â€œThe sameâ€ means the same as seeing and touching.ğŸ”½â€œHow is it that the idea arises, â€˜I see and I touchâ€™?â€

original: 'o na ji ltar bdag gis mthong bar gyur pa nyid la reg go zhes rtogs pa skye zhe na gzugs dang zhes gsungs so //ğŸ”½de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bdag gis mthong bar gyur pa nyid la reg go zhes rtogs pa skye zhe na gzugs dang zhes gsungs so // de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: â€œbecause of the form, etc.â€ğŸ”½The same is taught in the line: â€œThus, the eye is for the sake of the mere knowledge of form.â€ğŸ”½The knowledge of form only is the engagement for the sake of the characteristic.

original: mig ni gzugs tsam nyid rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gzugs tsam rtogs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don du 'jug pa yin la gzhan ni zhes bya ba reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa ni /ğŸ”½reg pa tsam nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs tsam nyid rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gzugs tsam rtogs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don du 'jug pa yin la gzhan ni zhes bya ba reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa ni / reg pa tsam nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other, i.e., that which arises from the faculty of touch, is for the sake of the mere knowledge of touch.

original: rig pa 'jug pa yin no zhes mthong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa 'jug pa yin no zhes mthong ngo //
translated: The knowledge of touch only is the engagement for the sake of the object.ğŸ”½Thus, one sees.

original: re zhig 'di las gcig gis kyang blta bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba'i thun mong pa'i dngos po yongs su 'bad pa ni med do //
analyzed: re zhig 'di las gcig gis kyang blta bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba'i thun mong pa'i dngos po yongs su 'bad pa ni med do //
translated: For a while, neither of them has a common object that is to be seen or touched.

original: 'o na shes pa gzhan gyis gcod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na shes pa gzhan gyis gcod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the other consciousnesses are the severer,

original: de dag phan tshun zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that they are mutually dependent.

original: gzugs dang reg pa de dag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa de dag go //
translated: Those are form and touch.

original: mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa bdag ste gcig nyid du'o //
analyzed: mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa bdag ste gcig nyid du'o //
translated: â€œSeeingâ€ means that form and touch are the same, that is, one.

original: bdag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg go zhes rtogs par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg go zhes rtogs par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is known that the thought is â€œI see that, and I touch that.â€

original: reg pa ni gzugs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa ni gzugs la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because touch does not engage form.

original: sngar mthong ba ni gzugs la reg pa nyid du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ni gzugs la reg pa nyid du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The seeing that occurs earlier engages touch as form.

original: mngon par zhes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no â€œIâ€ that is the experiencer.

original: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: This is stated in terms of the reversal of the above, â€œIf you say that the other consciousnesses are the severer, then it is said that they are mutually dependent.â€

original: / mthong ba'i dkar po gang yin pa de nyid reg pas dri ma can du byed pa dang / de nyid yin no zhes lag par gzung bar yang dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / mthong ba'i dkar po gang yin pa de nyid reg pas dri ma can du byed pa dang / de nyid yin no zhes lag par gzung bar yang dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the very white color that is seen is defiled by contact, and that it is not perceived as being the same as that which is held in the hand?

original: ji ltar don gcig tu mngon par zhen pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gcig tu mngon par zhen pa med snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that there is no adherence to the same object,

original: mun khung na gnas pa gang gi tshe dngos po de la reg pa de'i tshe shes pas gang gis reg pa yul du gyur pa'i shes pa des gzugs rtogs pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: mun khung na gnas pa gang gi tshe dngos po de la reg pa de'i tshe shes pas gang gis reg pa yul du gyur pa'i shes pa des gzugs rtogs pa med do zhe na /
translated: then when one who is in the dark touches that object, the cognition by which it is touched does not cognize the form that is the object of the cognition.

original: de'i tshe mngon sum nyid tha dad rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum nyid tha dad rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tha dad pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no /
translated: At that time, because the direct perception itself is cognized as different, the difference is not established by inference.

original: phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa 'dzin par byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa 'dzin par byed pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase that which apprehends each other refers to the apprehension of form and touch.

original: mngon sum dag ces bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: mngon sum dag ces bya ba ni gzugs dang reg pa 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: The phrase the two direct perceptions refers to the apprehension of form and touch.

original: 'jug pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase without engagement means that the two direct perceptions do not engage each other.

original: phan tshun te gzugs 'dzin par byed pa reg pa'i rnam pas stong la reg pa 'dzin pa yang gzugs kyi rnam pas stong pa na /
analyzed: phan tshun te gzugs 'dzin par byed pa reg pa'i rnam pas stong la reg pa 'dzin pa yang gzugs kyi rnam pas stong pa na /
translated: The eye is empty of the aspect of contact, which is the apprehender of form, and contact is empty of the aspect of form.

original: mngon sum gyis tha dad pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur la mngon sum gyis tha dad pa yongs su bcad pas na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis tha dad pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur la mngon sum gyis tha dad pa yongs su bcad pas na'o //
translated: When they are differentiated by direct perception, they are differentiated by direct perception.

original: 'o na @208b kyang yid kyis rtogs pa tshad mar 'gyur bar ji ltar 'os snyan na dbang po las skyes pa nyid ces smras so //
analyzed: 'o na @208b kyang yid kyis rtogs pa tshad mar 'gyur bar ji ltar 'os snyan na dbang po las skyes pa nyid ces smras so //
translated: But how can mental understanding be valid cognition? It is said to arise from the sense faculties.

original: dbang po las byung kho na tshad ma yin no zhes sangs rgyas pa mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'di la tshad ma 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: dbang po las byung kho na tshad ma yin no zhes sangs rgyas pa mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'di la tshad ma 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no valid cognition that engages this object, which is what the Buddhists manifestly assert.

original: des na dbang po las skyes pa kho na tshad ma yin no zhes 'dis tshad ma ma yin par ji ltar brjod gal te yid tshad ma yin pa la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: des na dbang po las skyes pa kho na tshad ma yin no zhes 'dis tshad ma ma yin par ji ltar brjod gal te yid tshad ma yin pa la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it is not valid cognition, when it is said that only what arises from the sense faculties is valid cognition? If mental understanding is valid cognition, must a reason be stated?

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad tshad mar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni dngos po las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad tshad mar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni dngos po las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be a valid cognition.

original: gal te dbang po las byung ba dang dbang po las byung ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po las byung ba dang dbang po las byung ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin na /
translated: If it were the case that something was a valid cognition simply because it arose from a sense faculty,

original: yid las skyes pa yang yid las skyes pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus so //
analyzed: yid las skyes pa yang yid las skyes pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus so //
translated: then it would be possible to say that mental direct perception is a valid cognition simply because it arises from the mind.

original: de nyid kyi brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the point he is making.

original: yid ni yid kho na ste /
analyzed: yid ni yid kho na ste /
translated: The mind is the mind itself.ğŸ”½It is called mental direct perception because it arises from the mind.

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what he is saying.

original: rjes su dpag par ni mi 'khrul par tshu rol mthong bas ma rtogs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par ni mi 'khrul par tshu rol mthong bas ma rtogs te /
translated: The opponent replies: â€œIt is not understood by one who sees only this side, that is, by one who has not realized the nonerroneous.

original: mi 'khrul ba ni rjes su dpag pa kho na las rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba ni rjes su dpag pa kho na las rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is understood only by inference, which is nonerroneous.â€

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, â€œIn that case . . .â€

original: sngar mthong ba nyid ces bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba nyid ces bya ba ni brgal zhing brtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The phrase what was seen before is a form of objection.

original: khyod kyis ni rig pa pas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni rig pa pas so //
translated: You, means you who are the knower.

original: de'i tshe ji skad brjod par blta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji skad brjod par blta'o //
translated: You should see what is said at that time.

original: gzhan gyis de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: Because it is understood in that way by another, he said.

original: gcig nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is because it is understood as being the same.

original: lan du 'di ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du 'di ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is This is not so.

original: de nyid des na dri ba 'dir reg pa pa'i lan yin no //
analyzed: de nyid des na dri ba 'dir reg pa pa'i lan yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the response to the question.

original: lan gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: lan gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: By what? is the expression of the response.

original: / de yin par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin par ro zhes rnam pa 'di gzhan rjes su dpag pa ston pa de nyid do //
analyzed: / de yin par zhes bya ba ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin par ro zhes rnam pa 'di gzhan rjes su dpag pa ston pa de nyid do //
translated: The phrase that is refers to the fact that whatever is seen is the same as what is touched. This is another way of teaching the inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de nyid khas len pas brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de nyid khas len pas brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the inference, he said.

original: gzugs ni nyams par byed pa yin te des na gzugs nyid reg pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni nyams par byed pa yin te des na gzugs nyid reg pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Form is what is destroyed, he thought. Therefore, form itself is the contact.

original: lan ni reg pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni reg pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: â€œWhen there is contact, etc. â€

original: reg pa ni zhes bya ba la dkar po cig shos sngon po dag la mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: reg pa ni zhes bya ba la dkar po cig shos sngon po dag la mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Contact is the common nature of the white and the blue.

original: des na reg pas 'di dkar po yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs te sngon po la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na reg pas 'di dkar po yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs te sngon po la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, how can it be understood that this is white through contact, since it also exists in the blue?

original: mtshungs pa ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ni reg bya'o //
translated: Contact is the common nature.

original: mi mtshungs pa ni dkar @209a * //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa ni dkar @209a * //
translated: White is the uncommon nature.

original: po'o ; / ci ste rtogs so zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i dus na gzugs la sogs pa yang rtogs so zhe na lan ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: po'o ; / ci ste rtogs so zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i dus na gzugs la sogs pa yang rtogs so zhe na lan ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that it is understood, then the answer is: â€œAt the time of contact, form, etc. , are also understood. â€

original: rnam par dpyad pa nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The analysis itself is stated: â€œWhat is the difference between the two? â€

original: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa na zhes bya bar tha dad par khas len na'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa na zhes bya bar tha dad par khas len na'o //
translated: If it is accepted that there is a difference in the difference between form, etc.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba thun mong ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba thun mong ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //
translated: It is said that it is known by the nature of the uncommon consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of its uniqueness.

original: 'on te gal te 'di brjod par bya ba yin mod de ltar na yang de ltar ci ste mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te 'di brjod par bya ba yin mod de ltar na yang de ltar ci ste mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: But if it is to be expressed, then why is it not understood in that way?

original: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni zhes smos te ;
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni zhes smos te ;
translated: It is said, It is not to be taught.

original: ha cang thal pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Because of the absurdity of that, it is thought.

original: de'i phyir na de ltar rtogs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de ltar rtogs pa nyid las so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, because of the understanding in that way.

original: shes pa de yis ni zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pa'i shes pas de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba gal te don de snang na'o //
analyzed: shes pa de yis ni zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pa'i shes pas de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba gal te don de snang na'o //
