analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni sgrar snang ba'i shes pa la'o // de las rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase from that refers to the cognition that appears as sound.

original: sgra'i shes pa las so //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa las so //
translated: The phrase from another aspect refers to the cognition of sound.ğŸ”½The phrase because of the absence of a relation explains the reason.

original: shes pa thams cad ni rang gi rang bzhin mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ni rang gi rang bzhin mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because all cognitions are directed inward explains the reason.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½gal te de ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi yul yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa'o // gal te de ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi yul yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The phrase that refers to the cow, etc.ğŸ”½If you say that the object of inference is like that, then the object of inference would be expressed.

original: de rjes su dpag pa'i yul du brjod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas gzhan brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa'i yul du brjod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas gzhan brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that, he says, Well then, in order to state another position.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The word no is a negation.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa las mi snang ba la ji ltar 'jug ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa las mi snang ba la ji ltar 'jug ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent asks, But how can one engage in what is not perceived through inference?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is In all cases...

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las yang ngo //
translated: The word again refers to perception and inference.

original: de nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i yul kun rdzob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i yul kun rdzob pa nyid do //
translated: The word just refers to the object of conventional reality.

original: gal te de nyid kyis don dam par 'gyur ro snyam na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyis don dam par 'gyur ro snyam na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks it is just that which is ultimate, the response is If...

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul gyi'o //
translated: The phrase its nature refers to the object that is the nature of the sense consciousness.

original: de las ni sgra las rtogs pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: de las ni sgra las rtogs pa'i yul la'o //
translated: From that, the object that is understood from words.

original: 'di brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the phrase If...

original: de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If so, then others would also understand the object indicated by the nature of the manifestation.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the phrase by apprehending the nature of the manifestation...

original: gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa yin na /
translated: If it is consciousness that has the nature of the manifestation,

original: de'i tshe gsal ba'i dngos po rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba'i dngos po rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the object of illumination is realized.

original: des na sgra las byung ba'i shes pas kyang gsal bar snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na sgra las byung ba'i shes pas kyang gsal bar snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even the cognition that arises from sound apprehends the appearance of illumination. This is the intended meaning.

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang sgra'i shes pa gang yin pa de gnyis kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag gis tha dad kyang ngo shes pa las gcig nyid du mi gsal lo zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang sgra'i shes pa gang yin pa de gnyis kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag gis tha dad kyang ngo shes pa las gcig nyid du mi gsal lo zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the two, the cognition of the sense faculty and the cognition of sound, have different aspects, and that although they are distinguished by being illuminated and not illuminated, they are not distinguished as one by recognition,

original: lan ni de yang ngo zhes @212b bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang ngo zhes @212b bya ba'o //
translated: the reply is: That is also so.

original: gnod par byed pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the fault is:

original: rtogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The difference in realization.

original: ji ltar yod snyam na dran par bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yod snyam na dran par bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it? It is said: the object of memory.

original: de ltar na yang rnam pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rnam pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Even so, how can there be a difference in aspects?

original: dran pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: that memory.

original: ngo shes pa'i mtshan nyid de ni'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i mtshan nyid de ni'o //
translated: That is the characteristic of recognition.

original: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i dngos po la yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i dngos po la yin no //
translated: Seeing is the direct perception of the present thing.

original: des na ngo shes pa dang mthong ba gnyis 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ngo shes pa dang mthong ba gnyis 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since the two, recognition and seeing, are subjects of past and present objects, they are definitely different aspects.

original: de'i phyir de nyid yul gcig pa'i gnod byed yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid yul gcig pa'i gnod byed yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that is the refutation of their having the same object.

original: bstan zin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan zin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It has been explained

original: dbang tshogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang tshogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
translated: because of the sense faculty, the collection, and the result.

original: zhes bya ba der 'o na ji ltar ngo shes pa de skyed snyam na mthong ba las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der 'o na ji ltar ngo shes pa de skyed snyam na mthong ba las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks, â€œHow is that recognition produced?,â€ it is from seeing.

original: sun phyung ba'i rnam pa brjod pa ni brjod pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun phyung ba'i rnam pa brjod pa ni brjod pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the refutation is â€œthe expression . . . â€

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du yang brjod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du yang brjod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the nonestablishment of the reason is â€œthe concomitance . . . â€

original: ci ltar na mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam yin snyam na /
translated: How is it mere conceit?

original: mthong ba ji lta bzhin zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: mthong ba ji lta bzhin zhes bya ba'o//
translated: â€œJust as it is seen . . . â€

original: spyi ni mthong ba ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ni mthong ba ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that a universal is not seen.

original: gzhan yang mthong ba la sgra'i rnam par shes pas ma reg na ste ma rtogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong ba la sgra'i rnam par shes pas ma reg na ste ma rtogs na yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, if the visual consciousness does not touch, i.e., does not perceive, the form of the word,

original: 'brel pa ma rtogs par 'brel pa rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma rtogs par 'brel pa rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to perceive a relation without perceiving the relata.

original: gang gi phyir de lta min pa des mthong ba nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir de la ci yod do zhes ji ltar rtogs bum pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ni de la chu yod do zhes rtogs par srid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta min pa des mthong ba nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir de la ci yod do zhes ji ltar rtogs bum pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ni de la chu yod do zhes rtogs par srid do //
translated: Since it is not so, how can one understand that there is water in the pot, if one does not understand the pot?

original: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa ste rjes su song ba'i spyi gang yin pa 'dzin pa der nus pa de'i lam du gnas pa'i mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa ste rjes su song ba'i spyi gang yin pa 'dzin pa der nus pa de'i lam du gnas pa'i mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The perception of the universal, whether it is conceived as different or non-different from the individual, is not the perception of the individual, because the universal is not the object of the perception of the individual.

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi gzhan rjes su song ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi gzhan rjes su song ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because another aspect is not possible, i.e., because another universal is not possible.

original: rang nyid kyis goms pa bag chags dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed sngar gyi gsal ba mthong bas gzhag pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa'i sa bon sad pas nus pa gsal bar de ltar rtogs pa der zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis goms pa bag chags dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed sngar gyi gsal ba mthong bas gzhag pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa'i sa bon sad pas nus pa gsal bar de ltar rtogs pa der zhugs pa'o //
translated: The seed of the formative forces that are in conformity with the latent impressions of one's own habitual tendencies is activated and the potency is actualized in that way.

original: rigs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de med pa'i lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa de na rjes su mang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa de'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de med pa'i lam du zhugs pa gang yin pa de na rjes su mang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa de'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: The path of the absence of that realization which is the realization of the lineage and so on is due to the power of that realization which is characterized by the absence of multiplicity.

original: yid kyi mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain mental direct perception,

original: phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo re zhig 'chad pa ni /ğŸ”½yid kyang don dang chags la sogs //
analyzed: phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis mdo re zhig 'chad pa ni / yid kyang don dang chags la sogs //
translated: first of all, DignÄga's statement is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mind is also aware of objects and attachment and so on.

original: don dang chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag rig pa'o //ğŸ”½'dis ni yid kyi @213a * //
analyzed: don dang chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag rig pa'o // 'dis ni yid kyi @213a * //
translated: It is aware of those which have the nature of objects and attachment and so on.

original: mngon sum dang rang rig pa yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rang rig pa yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses mental direct perception and autocognition.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyis 'brel pa'i gzhung ni don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyis 'brel pa'i gzhung ni don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The text that is related to this sutra is â€œthe meaningâ€ and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi gtan tshigs ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gtan tshigs ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason of direct perception is â€œthe experience of the aspect.â€

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yid kyang yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yid kyang yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the mental consciousness is just the eye consciousness and so on,

original: smras pa mig la sogs pas skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa mig la sogs pas skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: we reply that what is produced by the eye and so on is just the sense consciousness.

original: 'on te de las zhes bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las skyed pa yid yin na'o //
analyzed: 'on te de las zhes bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las skyed pa yid yin na'o //
translated: But if you think that the mental consciousness is produced from that, that is, from the eye consciousness and so on,

original: 'dis zhes bya bas ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya bas ni yid kyis so //
translated: then it is said that â€œthis,â€ that is, the mental consciousness,ğŸ”½would not be the experiencer of the eye consciousness and so on.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni dran par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you accept that, then it is said that â€œit would not be possible to remember the object of the eye consciousness and so on.â€

original: brgya la grub pa'i mtha' pas rtogs pa las ngo shes pa gtan tshigs su smra bar 'gyur bas de la brjod pa ni ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brgya la grub pa'i mtha' pas rtogs pa las ngo shes pa gtan tshigs su smra bar 'gyur bas de la brjod pa ni ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that the mental consciousness is the experiencer of the eye consciousness and so on, then it is said that â€œthe mental consciousness would be different from itself.â€ğŸ”½But if you think that the mental consciousness is the experiencer of the eye consciousness and so on, then it is said that â€œthe mental consciousness would be different from itself.â€

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba gal te mig la sogs pa'i shes pas ma mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid yid kyis 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba gal te mig la sogs pa'i shes pas ma mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid yid kyis 'dzin na'o //
translated: As for â€œnot seen,â€ if the mind apprehends what is not seen by the eye consciousness and so on,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ma long bas so ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ma long bas so ;
translated: â€œby anotherâ€ means by one who is not blind.

original: / don thams cad 'dzin par thal ba ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar thal ba'o //
analyzed: / don thams cad 'dzin par thal ba ni thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar thal ba'o //
translated: The absurd consequence is that it would apprehend all objects, that is, it would be omniscient.

original: rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa snga mas yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ni shes pa snga mas yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: â€œThat very natureâ€ is the object that is determined by the previous cognition.

original: sngar yongs su bcad pa gang yin pa de nyid shes pa phyi mas bya dgos pa des na /
analyzed: sngar yongs su bcad pa gang yin pa de nyid shes pa phyi mas bya dgos pa des na /
translated: The later cognition must do what the previous cognition did, which is to determine that very object.ğŸ”½What would be the point of that?

original: des ci zhig bya 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des ci zhig bya 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
translated: The master of the Abhidharma says,

original: yongs su ma bcad pa la zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½gzhan gyis rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid do zhes smras so //
analyzed: yongs su ma bcad pa la zhes bya ba'o // gzhan gyis rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid do zhes smras so //
translated: â€œWith regard to what is not determined.â€ğŸ”½The opponent says, â€œIt appears as its own nature.â€

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa rang gi ngo bor snang ba de gzhan la yang zhes bya ba yongs su bcad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa rang gi ngo bor snang ba de gzhan la yang zhes bya ba yongs su bcad pa yang ngo //
translated: The master of the Abhidharma says, â€œThat which appears as its own nature is also determined by another.â€

original: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponentâ€™s response to this is â€œIn that case . . . â€

original: shes pa snga ma la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid shes pa phyi ma la yang yin no zhes smras pas rtag pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid shes pa phyi ma la yang yin no zhes smras pas rtag pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that since you are saying that what appears to the prior cognition is also what appears to the subsequent cognition, you are accepting that it is permanent.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas da ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas da ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the master says â€œnow . . . â€

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The idea is that this is not a refutation.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga mas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga mas so //
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ means by the prior cognition.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rtag pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is apprehended by another cognition,

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the idea is that this is not a refutation.

original: rtag pa gang la yid ches pa ste rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te de'i dngos po de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa gang la yid ches pa ste rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te de'i dngos po de'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œHow could one have confidence in a permanent thing?â€ means that one does not have confidence in or understand a permanent thing because of that thing.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis ni rtogs par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it cannot be understood by another cognition.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rtag pa @213b nyid du 'dzin pa gzhan du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rtag pa @213b nyid du 'dzin pa gzhan du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement â€œfor that reasonâ€ is the teaching of this. Because it is impossible to apprehend something as permanent in another way.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni snga mas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni snga mas so //
translated: â€œBy that veryâ€ means by the former.

original: ji ltar don med snyam na de'i rang bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar don med snyam na de'i rang bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: If one thinks that it is meaningless, then â€œits natureâ€ is stated.

original: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis kyang sngar gzung ba'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis kyang sngar gzung ba'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is understood as the nature of what was previously apprehended by another apprehender.

original: de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: â€œApprehending its aspectâ€ means manifesting one aspect.

original: de'i dus 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus 'dzin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i dus 'dzin par zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus 'dzin pa nyid du'o //
translated: â€œApprehending its timeâ€ means apprehending it as past.

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni yid tshad mar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni yid tshad mar byed pa'o //
translated: â€œOthersâ€ means those who take the mental consciousness as valid knowledge.

original: gal te yid kyi zhes bya ba ni gal te yid kyi dngos po gzung ba med na de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi zhes bya ba ni gal te yid kyi dngos po gzung ba med na de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œIf the mental consciousnessâ€ means if the mental entity is not apprehended, then at that time the mental consciousness would not remember it.

original: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pas gzung ba yid kyis dran par byed do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pas gzung ba yid kyis dran par byed do snyam na /
translated: If you think that the mental consciousness remembers what was apprehended by a sense consciousness,

original: 'dir 'gas zhes smras te /ğŸ”½bus bu gang 'ga' zhig gis myong ba'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'gas zhes smras te / bus bu gang 'ga' zhig gis myong ba'i dngos po ni /
translated: then we say:ğŸ”½No one ever remembers something experienced

original: de las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni dran pa ni nam yang med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni dran pa ni nam yang med do //
translated: by one person by means of another person.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran pa'i phyir dngos po mngon du byed pa'i yon tan ni yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pas dran pa'i phyir dngos po mngon du byed pa'i yon tan ni yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: Therefore, since the mental consciousness remembers, it does have the quality of perceiving things.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the opponentâ€™s refutation is stated in the phrase â€œif you think.â€

original: sngar ni 'bras bu las so //
analyzed: sngar ni 'bras bu las so //

original: med pa ni rgyu ste der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu ste der 'gyur ro //

original: rgyu sngar med pa yang nus pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu sngar med pa yang nus pa med do //

analyzed: gal te snang ba don gyi ngo bo yin na de'i sngon po la sogs pa lngar zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: 'di ga las she na de nyid yod pa la zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: snang ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni snang ba yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin la phyis de yang med do zhes bstan pa yin na /

analyzed: chos can gcig la snang ba dang mi snang ba phan tshun 'gal ba dag gnas pas ji ltar 'gyur ba mthong gi zhes bya ba snang ba dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: shes pa yod na zhes brjod pa ni /

original: dus mnyam pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na de ltar de ni zhes smras so // 'on te snang ba ni don las gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa la bdag @216a * //

If you claim that a cause produces an effect that is different from it, then you are also claiming that a cause produces an effect that is not different from it.

original: yul zhes bya ba don gcig par ga las rtogs par shes pa phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la rang bzhin gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba don gcig par ga las rtogs par shes pa phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la rang bzhin gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: How is it understood that the object is the same? Because there is no apprehension of the same nature in the case of mutually different cognitions.

original: yul gcig par ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gcig par ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the point of saying that the object is the same?

original: gal te ngo shes pas gcig nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pas gcig nyid du rtogs so zhe na /

analyzed: bde sogs la 'di zhes gsungs so //

original: de gcig pa'i phyir ni yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gcig pa'i phyir ni yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being the same, i.e., because of having the same object.

original: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' pa'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa rnams kyang tha dad pas na de la ngo shes pa ltar 'byung ba zhes dgongs pa'o // de lta na yang yul 'di ni gcig kho na yin te /
translated: The objects are also different, and therefore it is said that recognition arises in regard to them.

original: des na de la ngo shes pa 'thad pa kho na'o snyam na shes pa tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de la ngo shes pa 'thad pa kho na'o snyam na shes pa tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, this object is just one, and therefore recognition is tenable in regard to it.

original: gal te tha dad pa la do shes par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa la do shes par 'gyur ba ma yin na /

analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa la ngo shes pa ji ltar 'gyur bar 'gyur /

analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni / de la don dam par na zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'o na de las ci yin zhe na zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na de las ci yin zhe na zhes smos so //
translated: What is that?

original: de zhes bya ba shes pa gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba shes pa gcig pu'o //
translated: That is a single consciousness.

original: 'on te shes gzhan gyis rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs pa'am 'on te shes pa ni don gyis go bas rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs la yin /

original: gal te rang rig pa la brten nas brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa la brten nas brjod na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar ngo shes pa don gcig pa nyid kyis de gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa 'gyur / yongs su gsal bar tha dad par mthong ba rang rig pa'i shes pa la de nyid kyi tshe na ste /
translated: then how could recognition, which is the same object, be the superimposition of identity?ğŸ”½It is seen that the clarity of the two is different, and at that time,

analyzed: de yod pa'i dus nyid du gcig tu 'khrul par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: when reflexive awareness sees the two, it is not mistaken that they are the same.

original: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: â€œReflexive awarenessâ€ will be explained below.

original: des byas ba zhes bya ba ni yul gcig pa nyid kyis byas pa'o //

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The second position is stated:

original: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œBy another consciousness.â€

original: tha ma la brjod pa ni don gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma la brjod pa ni don gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The last position is stated: â€œBy implication.â€

original: des na zhes bya ba ni don tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni don tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThereforeâ€ means because there is no difference in meaning.

translated: Here, the opponentâ€™s position is stated:

original: rig pa tsam nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba tsam gyis ni rig pa ste /ğŸ”½shes pa tsam du 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa tsam nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba tsam gyis ni rig pa ste / shes pa tsam du 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: â€œIf it is mere cognition, cognition is grasped as mere clarity.ğŸ”½â€

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the master presents the following argument:

original: don gcig nyid ni shes pa du mas gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don gcig nyid ni shes pa du mas gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: â€œThe same object is not apprehended by many cognitions,

original: de'i shes pa gcig tu brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i shes pa gcig tu brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: because its cognition is conceived as one.ğŸ”½â€

original: mtshams sbyor can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor can zhes bya ba ni /

original: dran pa yod phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa yod phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œBecause of memoryâ€ means

analyzed: dran pa ni snga ma nyid du rtogs pa tsam yin la mtshams sbyor ba snga phyi gcig tu byed pa ste /
translated: Memory is merely the understanding of the former, and having continuity is making the former and latter one.

analyzed: 'di'i nus pa ni de gnyis la yod pa yin no zhe na 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the capacity is in both, then this

analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag gi'o //

original: zlos pa ni skyor ba'o //
analyzed: zlos pa ni skyor ba'o //

analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba la shes pa las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: With regard to the phrase â€œas different or non-different,â€ it is with regard to the position that it is different or non-different from awareness.

original: shes pa dang dbye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa dang dbye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni /

original: des na ji ltar des don gcig tu rtogs par nus //

original: de'i tshe bdag ste shes pas rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag ste shes pas rtogs par byed pa yin la /

original: shes pa de yang tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de yang tha dad pa yin te /

analyzed: des na shes pa des bdag tha mi dad par ji ltar 'dzin /

original: zhig pa zhes gsungs so //

original: rang gi yul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul dang bral ba'o //

original: 'dzin pa'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'am zhes bya ba ni /

original: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of cognition.

original: 'dzin par byed pa por zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa por zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for apprehending,

original: kho bo cag gi 'dod pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin du ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi 'dod pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin du ste /
translated: it is the assertion of us Sautrantikas, because it is the nature of the agent.

original: byed pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent is not different.

original: bdag la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also the self, etc.

original: don mi snang na 'dzin par byed pa nyid du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mi snang na 'dzin par byed pa nyid du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object does not appear, then the apprehender would not appear.

original: de'i phyir re re la yang gnyis gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½des na rtsod pa 'di la bdag dang 'dra ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir re re la yang gnyis gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro // des na rtsod pa 'di la bdag dang 'dra ba nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, the error would arise that each would appear as two.ğŸ”½Therefore, in this dispute, the self is like a reflection,

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba bems po'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa 'di ni thog ma med /ğŸ”½pa'i dus can nyid yin gyi /ğŸ”½blo de bdag dang 'du ba can nam /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba bems po'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa 'di ni thog ma med / pa'i dus can nyid yin gyi / blo de bdag dang 'du ba can nam /
translated: or it is imputed to be of the nature of the object, but this is beginningless.ğŸ”½It is not that the mind is united with the self,

original: bems po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bems po'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: or that it is of the nature of an object,

original: don mi snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gdon mi za bar lan yin no //
analyzed: don mi snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gdon mi za bar lan yin no //
translated: because the consequence would be that the object would not appear.

original: de ltar na re zhig bram ze dang rig pa pa dag gis rang nyid kyis rnam par bzhag nas don gyi phyogs la nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bram ze dang rig pa pa dag gis rang nyid kyis rnam par bzhag nas don gyi phyogs la nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Thus, the Brahmins and logicians first posit the self and then, in regard to the object, they state the error

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf that were so, etc.

original: shes rab la sogs pa'am zhes bya ba'am gyi sgras ni bzhin sgra ston te /
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa'am zhes bya ba'am gyi sgras ni bzhin sgra ston te /
translated: The word â€œorâ€ indicates the word â€œlike.â€

original: shes rab la sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is â€œlike wisdom, etc.â€

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni bram ze dang rig pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni bram ze dang rig pa can la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œOthersâ€ are the Brahmins, logicians, etc.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement â€œin this caseâ€ is the following.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba bems po'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang don yang gsal bar byed pa'i blo gsal ba de yod pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba bems po'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang don yang gsal bar byed pa'i blo gsal ba de yod pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that there is such a thing as a clear awareness that is not of the nature of an insentient thing and that illuminates an object.

original: rgyu des na rtogs pa shes pa dang 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu des na rtogs pa shes pa dang 'dres pa ste /
translated: By that cause, the understanding is mixed with the cognition.

original: don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba yin gyi /
translated: The nature of the connection, etc., appears by the characteristic of being combined in one object.

original: rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: But it is not the nature of the understanding itself.

original: thog ma med pa'i goms pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de yod pa las bde ba la sogs pa 'di ni de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhes pas na de las tshul gzhan gang yin pa de bde ba la sogs pa bdag la 'du ba can ni
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i goms pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de yod pa las bde ba la sogs pa 'di ni de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin zhes pas na de las tshul gzhan gang yin pa de bde ba la sogs pa bdag la 'du ba can ni
translated: Since the nature of pleasure, etc. is understood in this way from the existence of the habitual propensities of beginningless conditioning, any other mode of understanding pleasure, etc.

original: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes @222a * //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi shes @222a * //
translated: is understood by a cognition that is unified with the self.

original: pas rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: pas rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Such conceptualization, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyis byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis byed pa ma yin no //
translated: is not done by the world.

original: lugs gzhan gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: lugs gzhan gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the mode of the other system is:

original: 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is like this and like that.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to express another fault, he says:

original: don gcig la bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gcig la bya ba'o //
translated: The activity is with respect to one object.

original: sa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi don gcig la 'du ba'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa na brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi don gcig la 'du ba'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa na brjod pa ni /
translated: With â€œthe earth,â€ etc., he teaches the proof of the unification with respect to the other object.ğŸ”½The expression is:

original: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn that case, thenâ€¦â€

original: 'di la gzhan gyi bdag ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi bdag ni zhes smras so //
translated: Here, he says, â€œthe other selfâ€¦â€

original: ji ltar de rag las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de rag las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How is it dependent?

original: gzhan la 'du ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan la 'du ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is not dependent on another.

original: gzhan la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'du ba yin par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la 'du ba yin par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on another, that is, it is understood to be dependent on another.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Impermanent is the reason.

original: rtag pas zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gi rtags yin la de yang mi rten pa'i yin no //
analyzed: rtag pas zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gi rtags yin la de yang mi rten pa'i yin no //
translated: Because of permanence is the reason for independence, and that is not dependent.

original: gcig kyang zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid dam rten nyid do //
analyzed: gcig kyang zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid dam rten nyid do //
translated: One also is the reason for quality or dependence.

original: de ni yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni yon tan nyid do //
translated: This is the reason for quality.

original: ci'i phyir yon tan nyid ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yon tan nyid ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not a quality?

original: gzhan la brten pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Because dependence on another is not established.

original: rdzas la brten pa yon tan ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yid kyi rgyu mtshan yin na /
analyzed: rdzas la brten pa yon tan ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yid kyi rgyu mtshan yin na /
translated: If a quality is dependent on substance, etc., and the quality is the mental representation of the cause,

original: 'dir rdzas la brten pa nyid ni grub pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir rdzas la brten pa nyid ni grub pa med do //
translated: here the dependence on substance is not established.

original: de'i phyir yon tan du 'gyur ba yin la de lta na yang phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan du 'gyur ba yin la de lta na yang phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o//
translated: Therefore, it is a quality. But even so, there is the fault of mutual dependence. This is the idea.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni rang dbang nyid ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni rang dbang nyid ma yin te zhes 'brel to //
translated: â€œPleasure, etc. are not independentâ€ is the connection.

original: bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa las bzlog pa mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa las bzlog pa mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBecause of the reversalâ€ means because of the impermanence which is the opposite of permanence.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'grel pa'i don du lhag pa yang brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don 'grel pa'i don du lhag pa yang brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is stated for the purpose of commenting on the meaning of the verse: â€œIfâ€ means â€œif it is so.â€

original: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni med pa de'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni med pa de'o //
translated: â€œHow is that?â€ means â€œhow is that non-existence?â€

original: gal te rag las pa'i chos nyid la de'i tshe yod pa nyid yin par 'thad kyi med pa 'di ji ltar 'gyur ji ltar re zhig rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rag las pa'i chos nyid la de'i tshe yod pa nyid yin par 'thad kyi med pa 'di ji ltar 'gyur ji ltar re zhig rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: If it is the nature of dependence, then existence is tenable, but how is this non-existence? How is it established as having the nature of consciousness?

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du yang nyid kyis bsgrub po //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du yang nyid kyis bsgrub po //
translated: It is also established by itself as having the nature of self-awareness.

original: de lta na yang slob dpon gyi sgo nas kyang bsgrub pa'i don du brjod pa na /
analyzed: de lta na yang slob dpon gyi sgo nas kyang bsgrub pa'i don du brjod pa na /
translated: Even so, when it is stated for the purpose of establishing by the master,

original: bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said â€œpleasure, etc.â€

original: myong na phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: myong na phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is experienced, it becomes the nature of benefit.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Or, â€œby anotherâ€ means not produced by the sense faculty.

original: don gang ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gang ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œObjectâ€ means form, etc.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa yang mi bzhugs pas de la blo sbyor ba ma yin nam bde ba la sogs pa la yang mig 'jug @222b pa kho na ste des na der yang de sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na bdag gi mig ces bya ba'o
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa yang mi bzhugs pas de la blo sbyor ba ma yin nam bde ba la sogs pa la yang mig 'jug @222b pa kho na ste des na der yang de sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na bdag gi mig ces bya ba'o
translated: If form, etc. do not exist, is the mind not applied to them? Pleasure, etc. are also applied to the eye, and therefore the mind is applied to them.

original: // 'on te bde ba la mi bzhugs kyang de'i yul la rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur zhes gzhan gyis bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // 'on te bde ba la mi bzhugs kyang de'i yul la rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur zhes gzhan gyis bstan pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If pleasure does not exist, the consciousness that arises from it would not exist.

original: bde ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs nyid rnam par zhugs pa'i mig gis 'jug pa ste bskyed par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: bde ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs nyid rnam par zhugs pa'i mig gis 'jug pa ste bskyed par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If the consciousness that apprehends pleasure arises from the eye that engages form,

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the VaibhÄá¹£ika says, â€œIf that is so,â€

original: gal te gcig zhugs pa'i mig gis yul gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed na /
analyzed: gal te gcig zhugs pa'i mig gis yul gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed na /
translated: if the consciousness of another object arises from the eye that engages one object,

original: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa la gcig la zhugs pa'i mig gis khams gsum pa thams cad kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa la gcig la zhugs pa'i mig gis khams gsum pa thams cad kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the eye that is engaged with one thing, such as a pot, would generate a consciousness that has as its object all things in the three realms.

original: de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa gzhan la zhugs pa'i mig gis lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa gzhan la zhugs pa'i mig gis lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ni //
translated: In the same way, the eye that is engaged with another thing, such as smoke, would generate a consciousness that has as its object a hidden object.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: Inference would also arise from the eye. This is absurd.

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that apprehends is the form of consciousness that apprehends pleasure, etc.

original: rgyu des na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu des na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin par brjod do zhe na /
translated: Because of that cause, it is said that pleasure, etc., are apprehended by that eye consciousness itself.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is â€œWell then . . .â€

original: rnam par brtag par zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The object of conception is the form of the object of conception.

original: dus mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Simultaneous with the object is . . .

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa'i'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa'i'o //
translated: and the sense consciousnesses are simultaneous.

original: de la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in that case, the aspect of the apprehender is not observed to be different.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya ba me la sogs pa yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan ma dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya ba me la sogs pa yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan ma dmigs te /
translated: In the same way, the object of inference, such as fire, is not observed to be apprehended by something else.

original: des na der yang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyis gzung bar thal lo zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: des na der yang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyis gzung bar thal lo zhes brjod zin to //
translated: Therefore, in that case, it would absurdly follow that the sense consciousness itself apprehends it.

original: gzhan gyis 'on te zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'on te zhes smras te /
translated: But another says, â€œWell then,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa las de de lta bu'i zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa las de de lta bu'i zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: the object of inference is understood by the nature of inference from the aspect of the apprehended that has the characteristics of the object of inference.â€

original: de bzhin du rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra la sogs pa dbang po dang dus mtshungs pa la byung ba la yang gzung ba'i rnam pa mthong ba las 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par brtag pa gzhan rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra la sogs pa dbang po dang dus mtshungs pa la byung ba la yang gzung ba'i rnam pa mthong ba las 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par brtag pa gzhan rtog pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in the case of sound and so on, which are to be imagined, the aspect of the apprehender is imagined to be different from the seen aspect of the apprehended, which occurs simultaneously with the sense faculty.

original: 'di mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe same applies hereâ€ means that it is to be inferred and imagined.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection that the opponent might have is anticipated:

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½gal te rjes su dpag @223a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o // gal te rjes su dpag @223a * //
translated: â€œEven pleasure, etc.,â€ğŸ”½If, in the case of what is to be inferred, etc., one imagines a separate apprehender on the ground that one sees the form of the apprehended,

original: par bya ba la sogs pa la gzung ba'i rnam par mthong ba las 'dzin par byed pa gzhan rtog na de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa yang gzung ba'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: par bya ba la sogs pa la gzung ba'i rnam par mthong ba las 'dzin par byed pa gzhan rtog na de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa yang gzung ba'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: then, since one sees the form of the apprehended even in the case of pleasure, etc.,ğŸ”½why is the apprehender not imagined to be different from the form of the sense faculty?

original: dbang po'i rnam par rnam pa las gzhan par byed pa ci ste mi rtag ces dogs pa bsu nas 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par rnam pa las gzhan par byed pa ci ste mi rtag ces dogs pa bsu nas 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated and refuted: â€œNo, because . . .â€

original: gal ta gzung ba nyid du myong na de la 'dzin par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin te //
analyzed: gal ta gzung ba nyid du myong na de la 'dzin par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin te //
translated: If it is experienced as the apprehended, then it is to be imagined that there is a separate apprehender.

original: dper na rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the case of what is to be inferred, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni gzung ba nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin na ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni gzung ba nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin na ji ltar 'dzin par byed pa gzhan brtag par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If pleasure, etc. are not experienced as objects, how can they be investigated as something else that apprehends?

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid du myong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pha rol pos brjod pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa ni don gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid du myong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pha rol pos brjod pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa ni don gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponentâ€™s statement is refuted by â€œin the same object.â€

original: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis bya ba ni shes pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: The function of the apprehender is by another cognition.

original: des na 'dir yang gzung ba nyid mthong ba las 'dzin par byed par gzhan rtogs shig ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang gzung ba nyid mthong ba las 'dzin par byed par gzhan rtogs shig ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here too, the apprehender is understood as something else, from seeing the object.

original: gcig tu 'dres pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig tu 'dres pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œIn the same objectâ€ means

original: shes pa dang bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa dran pa nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa dran pa nyid du snang ste /
translated: the cognition, the self, and pleasure, etc. appear as memory.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are not objects.

original: de la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la yang dngos po med pa yod na /
translated: â€œIf it were not soâ€ means if things and non-things also had non-things,

original: de'i tshe ngag tha dad par bya ba la yang gcig la gcig med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa gzhan dag la de la yang gzhan @228a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe ngag tha dad par bya ba la yang gcig la gcig med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa gzhan dag la de la yang gzhan @228a * //
translated: then at that time, even in the case of different statements, in other non-things that have the character of one anotherâ€™s absence,

original: yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: Because of that, there would be an infinite regress.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: gal te dngos po med pa dngos po las gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa dngos po las gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If non-entity is not different from entity,

original: de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gzhan te tha dad par 'dzin pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gzhan te tha dad par 'dzin pa ji ltar yin /
translated: then how could entity and non-entity be apprehended as different, as distinct?

original: mngon sum dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that entity and non-entity are different because the two valid cognitions that apprehend them, perception and non-perception, are different,

original: tha dad med par zhes smos te /
analyzed: tha dad med par zhes smos te /
translated: we reply, â€œThere is no non-difference.â€

original: tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa ni med de /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa ni med de /
translated: There is no apprehension of non-difference,

original: thams cad du tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because everything would be just different.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the second half of the verse begins with â€œIf you say . . . â€

analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œAnotherâ€ refers to auditory consciousness, etc.

original: des na ji ltar der byed pa po rnams tha dad par gzung yang tha mi dad par gzung bar rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshad ma gnyis kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tha dad par rtogs kyang tha mi dad par yang rtogs par
analyzed: des na ji ltar der byed pa po rnams tha dad par gzung yang tha mi dad par gzung bar rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshad ma gnyis kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tha dad par rtogs kyang tha mi dad par yang rtogs par
translated: In the same way, although the two valid cognitions realize things and nonthings as different, they are also able to realize them as not different.

original: nus pa yin no zhes rtsod pa brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa yin no zhes rtsod pa brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression â€œin this wayâ€ refers to the above.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la'o //
translated: â€œIn this wayâ€ refers to things and nonthings.

original: dngos po med pa las tha dad par rtogs pa de gang yin pa de yang thogs pa med pa'i bag chags nyid las 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las tha dad par rtogs pa de gang yin pa de yang thogs pa med pa'i bag chags nyid las 'gyur te /
translated: The realization of nonthings as different from things is also due to the mere habitual tendency of nonobstruction.

original: des na dngos po las don gzhan dngos po med pa brtags pas ci zhig bya dngos po med pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin na blo de ni gzhan du yang ma 'thad pas da ni dngos po med pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na dngos po las don gzhan dngos po med pa brtags pas ci zhig bya dngos po med pa'i blo'i rgyu mtshan du dngos po med pa rtogs pa yin na blo de ni gzhan du yang ma 'thad pas da ni dngos po med pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of positing nonthings as objects that are different from things? If the reason for the cognition of nonthings is the realization of nonthings, then since that cognition is not tenable in any other way, what is the point of nonthings?

original: gal te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de'i gzhal bya yod dgos so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma yod pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de'i gzhal bya yod dgos so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If you say that because there is a valid cognition called â€œnon-existence of an entity,â€ the object of that must exist,ğŸ”½we reply:

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the entity of non-existence?

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal yang mi srid pa yin /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal yang mi srid pa yin /
translated: If a valid cognition of non-existence and its object are not possible,

original: 'o na dngos po rnams phan tshun ldog pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po rnams phan tshun ldog pa nyid du 'gyur /

original: gang la gang gis dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la gang gis dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa mi 'gyur te /
translated: For, if something is not the non-existence and absence of something else,

original: bum pa la bum pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la bum pa'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then it is the nature of a pot, for example.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de dang mi 'dra nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de dang mi 'dra nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: We reply: It is not like that.

original: gal te mi 'dra ba nyid yod pa la tshad ma ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dra ba nyid yod pa la tshad ma ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is a valid cognition of difference in the case of existence,

original: mi 'dra ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply: Difference also.

original: de'i dus phyis 'byung ba de'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi dngos pos khyad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus phyis 'byung ba de'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi dngos pos khyad par byas pa'o //
translated: Because it arises later, it arises from the power of that. This is the reason that distinguishes it.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma des dngos po med par rtogs so snyam pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma des dngos po med par rtogs so snyam pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that the valid cognition of nonexistence realizes nonexistence, is that not seeing?

original: @228b des na dngos po med pa'i tshad ma med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: @228b des na dngos po med pa'i tshad ma med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bdag gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bdag gi bya ba'o //
translated: The valid cognition of nonexistence is the activity of the self.

original: so so rang gi zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa nyid kyis so sor nges pa'i'o //
analyzed: so so rang gi zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa nyid kyis so sor nges pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase â€œin each individual caseâ€ means that it is ascertained in each individual case by the analysis itself.

original: mtshungs pas na don gcig par ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pas na don gcig par ro //
translated: Since it is similar, it is the same object.

original: 'di nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'di nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is the valid cognition of nonexistence,

original: mi dmigs pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text states, â€œThat nonapprehension is also . . .â€

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba dngos po med pa'i cha 'dzin pa dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i lkog nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa yang tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba dngos po med pa'i cha 'dzin pa dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i lkog nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa yang tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the apprehension of the aspect of nonexistence that is not apprehended by direct perception is a different valid cognition of nonexistence, in the same way, memory would be a different valid cognition because it apprehends an object that is hidden from direct perception.

original: 'on te mi'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mi'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But when the human beingâ€™s hiddenness is known, then it is known by inference.

original: mngon sum la rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For inference does not operate when perception is present.

original: des lkog nyid rig pa la dgos pa yod pa nyid do zhe na rjes dpag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des lkog nyid rig pa la dgos pa yod pa nyid do zhe na rjes dpag ces bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that there is a purpose in knowing hiddenness, then it is inference.

analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid gzung ba las ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir rtsod pa byed pa ni 'di snyam na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir rtsod pa byed pa ni 'di snyam na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To explain the latter half of the verse, the opponent says, â€œIn that case . . .â€

original: des na 'di zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'o //
analyzed: des na 'di zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the definition of the operation of inference.

original: skye bzhin pa'i rjes su dpag pas me 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i rjes su dpag pas me 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The arising inference apprehends fire.

original: nges par bya ba la de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngar de sngon rol du lkog tu gyur pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni su yang med do //
analyzed: nges par bya ba la de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngar de sngon rol du lkog tu gyur pa nyid du nges par 'dzin pa ni su yang med do //
translated: â€œIn regard to the object to be ascertainedâ€ means that prior to the inference, no one apprehends hiddenness.

original: yang ji ltar na thams cad kyi tshe dgos pa ltos par bya ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na thams cad kyi tshe dgos pa ltos par bya ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how could it be that at all times, the purpose is to be relied upon?

original: sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, â€œit is the means of engagement.â€

original: des na gal te rjes su dpag pa skye ba na /
analyzed: des na gal te rjes su dpag pa skye ba na /
translated: Therefore, if inference arises,

original: res 'ga' lkog tu gyur pa nges pa nyid la ltos pa de'i ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' lkog tu gyur pa nges pa nyid la ltos pa de'i ni /

original: de sbyor bar byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de sbyor bar byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam rjes su 'gro ba dang de ldog pa nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de tsam rjes su 'gro ba dang de ldog pa nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of a cause is just that: the mere forward pervasion and mere counter pervasion.

original: dran pa ni rjes su dpag pas bya ba nyid du nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa ni rjes su dpag pas bya ba nyid du nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If memory is ascertained to be the object of inference,

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is inference.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid dran pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid dran pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur na'o //
translated: if the object of inference were to become the domain of memory,ğŸ”½then memory

original: dran pas ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: dran pas ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: would be inference.ğŸ”½Well then,

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: is the position of the opponent.

original: gal te dran pas de'i tshe yod pa yang du ma rtogs na de'i tshe de lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba de gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½sngon mthong ba po zhes bya @229a * //
analyzed: gal te dran pas de'i tshe yod pa yang du ma rtogs na de'i tshe de lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba de gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i don to // sngon mthong ba po zhes bya @229a * //
translated: If memory does not understand the existence of the object at that time, then what is it that understands the object to be hidden?ğŸ”½The example of the one who sees the fire is not the same.

original: ba ni dpe la mthong ba'i me nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin par dran pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba ni dpe la mthong ba'i me nyid lkog tu gyur pa yin par dran pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The one who sees the fire remembers the fire that was seen before, and so understands the fire to be hidden.

original: 'di brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is â€œBut in that case . . . â€

original: de'i dus kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi mthar thug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi mthar thug pa nyid do //
translated: The end of the time of the past is the end of the past time.

original: gzhan ni ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni dran pas rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni dran pas rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not different, the hiddenness that exists at the time of inference is not understood by memory.

original: de ltar na yang dran pas bya ba ci yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dran pas bya ba ci yod de /
translated: What is the function of memory in this case?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The hiddenness of the object of inference is not understood.

original: dran pas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: dran pas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The word â€œrememberingâ€ is a response to an objection.

original: 'di la brjod pa dran pas 'jug go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa dran pas 'jug go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is that the memory engages the object by means of the expression.

original: dpyod pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression is the form of the object that is analyzed.

original: gal te thob mi nus mong de lta na yang 'jug go snyam na rtogs ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thob mi nus mong de lta na yang 'jug go snyam na rtogs ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is thought that the memory engages the object even if it cannot be expressed, then the response is that the memory is not a valid cognition.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thob bya'i don med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thob bya'i don med na'o //
translated: â€œOtherwiseâ€ means if the object to be obtained does not exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The second alternative is stated:

original: da lta ba'i dus la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da lta ba'i dus la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn the present time . . . â€

original: rgyu des na dran pa ji ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu des na dran pa ji ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: For that reason, how can memory be a valid cognition?

original: bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa ni sngar gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the explanation is clarified: â€œThe memory . . . â€

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dus kyi don to //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi dus kyi don to //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the object of the past time.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa nyid ston pa ni mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa nyid ston pa ni mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the hidden object is apprehended by perception is: â€œBy perception . . . â€

original: dus kyi zhes bya ba da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi'o //
analyzed: dus kyi zhes bya ba da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi'o //
translated: â€œThe timeâ€ is the present time.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa nyid ni'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa nyid ni'o //
translated: The form of that is the form of a hidden object.

original: 'di ni 'di yin te lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du gzung bar mi nus so zhes de skad du ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di yin te lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du gzung bar mi nus so zhes de skad du ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: It is not possible to apprehend it in any way, saying, â€œThis is it, the hidden object.â€

original: 'on kyang dran pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs so zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid rtogs so zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma 'brel te /
translated: But it is not connected to say that memory understands the hidden object.

original: dran pas ni rang gi rnam pa tsam zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //ğŸ”½de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pas ni rang gi rnam pa tsam zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no // de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because memory only understands its own form.

original: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: That kind of memory is unclear.

original: lan ni don mos pa med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni don mos pa med ces bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: â€œThere is no interest in the object.â€

original: gal te don yin na don du mos pa yang yod par 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te don yin na don du mos pa yang yod par 'gyur na yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were the object, there would be interest in the object, but that does not exist.

original: des na don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the object.

original: dran pa'i rnam pa ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pa yin la de la ni mos pa de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa'i rnam pa ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pa yin la de la ni mos pa de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The form of memory is unclear, and there is no interest in that.

original: gal te bdag gi mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid dran pas yul du byas so zhes 'jig rten pa rnams las lhag par zhen pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid dran pas yul du byas so zhes 'jig rten pa rnams las lhag par zhen pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But don't worldly people think that what I see is the very thing that memory takes as its object?

original: des na ji ltar don du mos pa med snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ji ltar don du mos pa med snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: So how can it be that they do not believe in objects?

original: rnam par dpyod pa can dag ni 'di ltar rtogs kyi don nyid du lhag par mos @229b ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa can dag ni 'di ltar rtogs kyi don nyid du lhag par mos @229b ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thinkers of the world understand it this way, but they do not believe that memory has as its object a real entity called object.

original: de yan chad ni dran pa rang gi rnam pa tsam mngon du byed pa nyid du rim pa bzhin bsgrubs nas de ni dpe'i stobs nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pas rnam 'grel gyi bshad pa rtsom pa ni /
analyzed: de yan chad ni dran pa rang gi rnam pa tsam mngon du byed pa nyid du rim pa bzhin bsgrubs nas de ni dpe'i stobs nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrub pas rnam 'grel gyi bshad pa rtsom pa ni /
translated: From here on, Candrakirti proves in stages that memory is just the manifestation of its own aspect, and then he composes the commentary on the Pramanavarttika in order to prove by the power of example alone that pleasure and so forth are also by nature reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
