original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gtan tshigs skyes bu de nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i gtan tshigs skyes bu de nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason of apprehended object and apprehending subject is not ascertained by that person itself.

original: dgag pa khong nas bton nas bshad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dgag pa khong nas bton nas bshad pa gzhan yang gsungs pa ni /
translated: Another explanation is stated by way of refuting this:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, etc.

original: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Why is there no apprehended object and apprehending subject?

original: yod na'ang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yod na'ang zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, Even if they exist, etc.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod na yang ngo //
translated: Even if the apprehended object and apprehending subject exist,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa gzhan la'ang 'gyur /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa gzhan la'ang 'gyur /
translated: the apprehended object and apprehending subject would also be different, like a pot and a cloth, etc.

original: bems po'i rang bzhin can gyi blo 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bems po'i rang bzhin can gyi blo 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the inert mind to apprehend.

original: me long la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The mirror, etc. also would be mind, he implies.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why?

original: yang ci'i phyir myong bar bya ba yin pa tsam gyis sems pa can nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir myong bar bya ba yin pa tsam gyis sems pa can nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is it that mere experience is mind?

original: nang nyid du myong ba'i phyir nang nyid do //
analyzed: nang nyid du myong ba'i phyir nang nyid do //
translated: It is internal because it is experienced internally.

original: nang nyid du myong ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: nang nyid du myong ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: What is experienced internally is surely a delusion.

original: phyi rol nyid la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid la zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, â€œIt is external.â€

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni dngos gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni dngos gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the treatise: â€œWhat is the external?â€

original: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed par ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni phyi rol bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed par ro //
translated: The external is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi bde ba la sogs par yod pa yin te /
translated: If pleasure, etc. exist externally,

original: 'on kyang myong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin par zad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang myong ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin par zad do zhe na /
translated: then why is the experience not in the nature of the external?

original: myong ba yang gzhan la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: myong ba yang gzhan la zhes gsungs so //

original: myong ba'i phyi rol gyi rjes mi byed la /
analyzed: myong ba'i phyi rol gyi rjes mi byed la /

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po gzhan no zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po gzhan no zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: and it is not tenable that the external object is something else.

original: 'thad pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another argument is stated: Thus,

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rig pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rig pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: if it is not the case that the awareness of pleasure, etc. is engaged in the nature of self-awareness,

original: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis zhes gsungs so //ğŸ”½'o na gzugs la @233a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis zhes gsungs so // 'o na gzugs la @233a * //
translated: then the awareness of pleasure, etc. is of something else.ğŸ”½But form, etc. is not the awareness of something else.

original: sogs pa yang gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin no zhes gzugs la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa yang gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin no zhes gzugs la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that form, etc. is of something else.ğŸ”½It is included in that,

original: de'i nang du chud pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rnam pa can gyis rtogs pa'i nang du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du chud pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rnam pa can gyis rtogs pa'i nang du chud pa'o //
translated: that is, it is included in the realization of the aspect of pleasure.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a pot, etc.

original: dper na bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin yang phyi rol gyi bum pa yang yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du bde ba'i rnam pas bde ba rtogs na /
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin yang phyi rol gyi bum pa yang yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du bde ba'i rnam pas bde ba rtogs na /
translated: In the same way, if pleasure is realized by the aspect of pleasure,

original: phyi rol gnas pa bzlog du med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gnas pa bzlog du med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: it is certainly not the case that it is reversed from an external object.ğŸ”½This is the intention.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, it is said: â€œThat is not reasonable.â€

original: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa la gnas pa bum pa'i rnam pa la ni goms pa'i byed pa ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa la gnas pa bum pa'i rnam pa la ni goms pa'i byed pa ma rtogs te /
translated: There, in the aspect of a pot that is the basis of consciousness, the activity of habituation is not realized.

original: nges na gzhan bum pa nye bar gnas pas bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges na gzhan bum pa nye bar gnas pas bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: If so, because it is produced by the presence of another pot,

original: phyi rol gyi bum pa yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bum pa yang yod pa nyid do //

original: gal te bde ba rnam pa la yang goms pa'i byed pa rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bde ba rnam pa la yang goms pa'i byed pa rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the activity of habituation to the aspect of pleasure is not realized,

original: des gzhan nye bar gnas pa las 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des gzhan nye bar gnas pa las 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
translated: it would be from the presence of another.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: â€œIn pleasure, etc.â€

original: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa'i myong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa'i myong ba ste /
translated: The experience that is not of the nature of that, i.e., that is not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: skyes bus rig pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bus rig pa'o //
translated: is known by the person.

original: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rtsod pa rjes su brjod pa smras pa yin no //ğŸ”½de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi rtsod pa rjes su brjod pa smras pa yin no // de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, he states the opponentâ€™s objection with the words â€œbut it is said, etc.â€

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: â€œNot of its aspectâ€ means not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: des zhes bya ba de rnam pa can ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba de rnam pa can ma yin pas na'o //
translated: â€œBy thatâ€ means by that which is not of its aspect.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //ğŸ”½de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o // de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the person.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBecause it is not of its aspectâ€ means because it is not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa rig pa yin snyam na ;
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bde ba la sogs pa rig pa yin snyam na ;
translated: But how is pleasure, etc., known?

original: de'i zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: He says, â€œby that.â€

original: blo'i nang du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo'i nang du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œEnters the mindâ€ means

original: blo la gzugs brnyan du shar ba'o //
analyzed: blo la gzugs brnyan du shar ba'o //
translated: arises as an image in the mind.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the person.

original: blo'i nang du gtogs pa'i bde ba lhan cig 'du ba ste 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: blo'i nang du gtogs pa'i bde ba lhan cig 'du ba ste 'brel ba'o //
translated: The pleasure that is included in the mind is co-present with it.

original: 'brel pa yang blo gang la bde ba la sogs pa de'i gzugs brnyan shar ba de nyid las skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang blo gang la bde ba la sogs pa de'i gzugs brnyan shar ba de nyid las skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Co-presence is the arising of the reflection of a person from the very same thing from which the reflection of pleasure, etc. arises.

original: gal te blo dang myong ba phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin na de'i tshe tha dad par ji ltar ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te blo dang myong ba phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin na de'i tshe tha dad par ji ltar ma rtogs she na /
translated: If the mind and the experience are completely different, then how is it that they are not cognized as different?

original: des zhes smras so //
analyzed: des zhes smras so //
translated: He says, â€œby it.â€

original: 'du bas 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo gcig la skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'phos pa nyid 'du @233b ba'i sgras brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'du bas 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo gcig la skyes bu dang bde ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'phos pa nyid 'du @233b ba'i sgras brjod pa ni /
translated: Because of the connection of co-presence, the arising of the reflection of a person and the reflection of pleasure, etc. in one mind is called co-presence.

original: de ltar rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
translated: Having thus stated the objection, he states the conclusion:

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œperception.â€

original: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces dris pa na /
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces dris pa na /
translated: When asked, â€œWhat is this so-called mind?â€

original: grangs can gyi lhag par zhes pa zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: grangs can gyi lhag par zhes pa zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: the SÄá¹ƒkhya says, â€œthe dominant one.â€

original: rig pa de gang yin ces dris pa la brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa de gang yin ces dris pa la brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The question is, What is that awareness? The answer is, It is experience.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the proponent of the conclusion says:

original: tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With respect to what is different.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
translated: What is meant by that is different.

original: pha rol po rnam grangs nyid yin pa sel ba ni yul gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po rnam grangs nyid yin pa sel ba ni yul gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The exclusion of the opponent's position that it is just a synonym is stated with by the object.ğŸ”½Here, the proponent of the conclusion says:

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni rnam pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni rnam pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Without aspects.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: Awareness refers to a person.

original: skyes bu khas len pa'i rgyu ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu khas len pa'i rgyu ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: The cause of accepting a person is valid cognition.

original: de med pa'i phyir na khas len pa'i rgyu med pa yin na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na khas len pa'i rgyu med pa yin na /
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no cause for acceptance.

original: mngon sum med kyang rjes su dpag pa rig pa'i sgrub byed du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum med kyang rjes su dpag pa rig pa'i sgrub byed du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, Even without direct perception, inference can be the proof for awareness,

original: mngon sum zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes gsungs te /
translated: the response is, Direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inference is preceded by direct perception.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni tshad med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni tshad med pas na'o //
translated: Therefore means because of the absence of valid cognition.

original: myong ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las tha dad pa'o //
translated: â€œAnother feelingâ€ is different from pleasure and pain.

original: sangs rgyas pa khyed bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las nges par grol ba med pa nyid du ji ltar thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa khyed bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las nges par grol ba med pa nyid du ji ltar thal bar 'gyur /
translated: How does it follow that you Buddhists have no liberation from pleasure and pain?

original: gal te myong ba yod na ni de'i tshe bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las grol ba'i thar pa 'thad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te myong ba yod na ni de'i tshe bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las grol ba'i thar pa 'thad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there were a feeling, then liberation from pleasure and pain would be tenable.

original: gang gi tshe rig pa zhes bya ba med pa de'i tshe ji ltar thar te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig pa zhes bya ba med pa de'i tshe ji ltar thar te /
translated: But when there is no so-called awareness, how can there be liberation?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that pleasure and pain exist.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal yongs su 'dor bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal yongs su 'dor bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if the Buddhists want to abandon pleasure and pain,

original: rang bzhin zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes smos so //
translated: then the root text says, â€œTheir nature . . . â€

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bde ba dang sdug bsngal dor na chos med pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin bde ba dang sdug bsngal dor na chos med pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of consciousness, pleasure and pain, is abandoned, then there would be no phenomena, that is, the continuum of consciousness would be annihilated.

original: rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other nature.

original: rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar khas blangs nas nyes pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar khas blangs nas nyes pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that we are stating a fault by accepting that the nature is abandoned.

original: rang bzhin ni dor bar yang mi nus so zhes brjod ba ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dor bar yang mi nus so zhes brjod ba ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that the nature cannot be abandoned, and that is what is meant by â€œown.â€

original: rang gi phyogs la 'thad pa brjod pa ni bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la 'thad pa brjod pa ni bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of what is correct for our own position is â€œpleasure, etc.â€

original: da lta'i gnas skabs ni ma grol ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: da lta'i gnas skabs ni ma grol ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The present state is the state of not being liberated.

original: de lta na yang spang bar nus pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na yang spang bar nus pa nyid de /
translated: Even so, it is still possible to abandon it,

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa las thar pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½tha dad par zhes bya @234a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pa las thar pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro // tha dad par zhes bya @234a * //
translated: because it is said that liberation is from the knowledge of the difference between the nature and the person.

original: ba ni myong ba las tha dad par lhag par nges pa gang yin pa de'i spyod yul du byas pa'o zhes 'di la grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ba ni myong ba las tha dad par lhag par nges pa gang yin pa de'i spyod yul du byas pa'o zhes 'di la grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni /
translated: â€œDistinctâ€ means that it is the object of that which is ascertained as distinct from experience.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of our philosophical position is â€œIf you say . . .â€

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang myong ba dag tha mi dad na de'i tshe 'dod pa'i thar pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dang myong ba dag tha mi dad na de'i tshe 'dod pa'i thar pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If pleasure, etc. and experience are not different, then at that time the attainment of liberation that is desired will not be accomplished at all.

original: bdag gi 'dod pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'dod pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: But it is said, my desire.

original: don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag tha dad pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the nature and the person are different.

original: 'on te rgyu dag ni bdag cag gi 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dag ni bdag cag gi 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: But the causes are the accomplishes of our desire.

original: des na gal te tha dad pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: des na gal te tha dad pa ma yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if they are not different,

original: rgyu rnams tha dad pa nyid skyed par mi byed do zhes na rgyun rnams yin zhes gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu rnams tha dad pa nyid skyed par mi byed do zhes na rgyun rnams yin zhes gnas so //
translated: the causes do not generate difference.  The reply is, The continuums.

original: don 'di la zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang bral ba'i myong ba tsam la'o //
analyzed: don 'di la zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang bral ba'i myong ba tsam la'o //
translated: In this matter means in the mere experience of being free from pleasure, pain, etc.

original: gzhan dag tshad ma nyid ston pa ni da lta nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tshad ma nyid ston pa ni da lta nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The others teach the valid cognition, right now.

original: cha zhes bya ba ni bde sdug gi cha ste /
analyzed: cha zhes bya ba ni bde sdug gi cha ste /
translated: The part is the part of pleasure and pain.

original: de yod par mthong ba'i phyir na rig pa tsam zhig gnas par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de yod par mthong ba'i phyir na rig pa tsam zhig gnas par 'gyur ba yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Because it is seen to exist, awareness alone remains.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni da ltar bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni da ltar bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is â€œIf it were not so . . . â€

original: de ltar thar pa'i gnas skabs su yang rig pa gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thar pa'i gnas skabs su yang rig pa gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, he intends that even in the state of liberation, another awareness arises, but it is not different.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang sgra la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang sgra la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: â€œ In betweenâ€ refers to the interval between awareness and sound, etc.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: â€œ Anotherâ€ refers to the nature of the mind.

original: gal te don tha dad pa med par tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la lan ci yod snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gal te don tha dad pa med par tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la lan ci yod snyam pa'o //
translated: If it is asked, â€œIf there is no difference in the object, how can there be a difference?â€ what is the response?

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: â€œIf it were not so . . . â€

original: 'on te gcig dang du ma nyid med mod /
analyzed: 'on te gcig dang du ma nyid med mod /
translated: If there is neither singularity nor multiplicity,

original: dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gi ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag gi ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how can the entire presentation of entities be destroyed?

original: gcig dang du ma las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, â€œFrom singularity and multiplicity . . . â€

original: 'di zhes bya ba tha dad pa med par myong ba gcig nyid kyis sgrub byed ma yin na /ğŸ”½tha dad pa'i grub par byed pa yang mi 'grub po //ğŸ”½gcig ma grub na zhes bya ba tha mi dad par ma grub na /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba tha dad pa med par myong ba gcig nyid kyis sgrub byed ma yin na / tha dad pa'i grub par byed pa yang mi 'grub po // gcig ma grub na zhes bya ba tha mi dad par ma grub na /
translated: If the one experience is not established as non-different, then the establishment of difference is not established.

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: If the one is not established as non-different, then the establishment of both, i.e., difference and non-difference, is not established.

original: gang dag las chen po yod pa de dag thams cad la khyad par byed pa gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'dzin par byed pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag las chen po yod pa de dag thams cad la khyad par byed pa gnas skabs kyi khyad par 'dzin par byed pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have the great elements are all those who have the special states, i.e., the special states of the present, which are grasped by the conceptual thoughts.

original: ci ste mi 'dod ces bya ba ni tha dad par 'dod par bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'dod ces bya ba ni tha dad par 'dod par bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If you do not accept that, i.e., if you do not accept that the great elements are the cause of the special states, then you must accept that they are different.

original: des na tha dad pa med par rig pa ni gcig yin no zhes tha dad pa med par rig pa nyid gcig sgrub pa la sems tha dad pa sems kyi 'khor du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag gis ma nges so //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa med par rig pa ni gcig yin no zhes tha dad pa med par rig pa nyid gcig sgrub pa la sems tha dad pa sems kyi 'khor du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag gis ma nges so //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of non-difference is not established as one, because the cognition of non-difference itself is established as one by the mind and mental factors that are different.

original: blo dang @234b myong ba dag kyang res 'ga' de ltar tha dad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: blo dang @234b myong ba dag kyang res 'ga' de ltar tha dad par mthong ngo //
translated: Sometimes, however, the mind and experience are seen to be different.

original: des tha dad par ma rtogs kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des tha dad par ma rtogs kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if one does not understand them to be different, they would be different.

original: blo dang myong ba dag ni de lta ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blo dang myong ba dag ni de lta ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mind and experience are not like that.

original: 'o na sems las byung ba rnams la yang tha dad par mi 'dzin pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems las byung ba rnams la yang tha dad par mi 'dzin pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But there is no apprehension of the mental factors as different.

original: sems las byung ba dag ni zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag ni zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The mental factors are not like that.

original: / mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase â€œgrasping an image, etc.â€

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa 'du shes kyi rnam par shes pa nyid yin par dmigs kyi /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa 'du shes kyi rnam par shes pa nyid yin par dmigs kyi /
translated: means that the consciousness that grasps an image is the discrimination itself.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-conceptual.

original: des na ji ltar de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag snyam na /
translated: How then can you establish the existence of grasping an image, etc.?

original: ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang ngo //
translated: The phrase â€œin that caseâ€ means â€œeven in the absence of conceptualization.â€

original: ji ltar snyam na des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar snyam na des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is that? Therefore, it is said.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma grub pa'i le'ur ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni tshad ma grub pa'i le'ur ro //
translated: Previously means in the chapter on establishing valid cognition.

original: don gyi mthu las byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don gyi mthu las byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises from the power of the object,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de ltar gyi don yul can ni'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de ltar gyi don yul can ni'o //
translated: the consciousness of the yogi is the subject of that object.

original: med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de'i yul can no //
analyzed: med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de'i yul can no //
translated: The non-existent such as the horn of a rabbit is its object.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the statement is of the non-existent.

original: de lta bu gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu gang yin de la nus pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu gsal ba'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu gang yin de la nus pa'o //
translated: That which has such a nature as a manifestation is the effect. There is potency in that.

original: gang du gzhan na med pa'i yul bsgoms pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu la nus pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang du gzhan na med pa'i yul bsgoms pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu la nus pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Also, that which is cultivated as an object that does not exist elsewhere is also the potency of the effect in the nature of the effect. Thus it is to be connected.

original: 'on te gang zhig don gyi mthu las mi skye ba de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig don gyi mthu las mi skye ba de rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is said that what does not arise from the power of the object is only conceptual, then it is said of what is unreal.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du'o //
translated: Thus means as the subject of a hidden object.

original: gal te bslad pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa yang 'gal te gsal ba'i rnam pa can du gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bslad pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa yang 'gal te gsal ba'i rnam pa can du gyur na /
translated: If, due to the influence of error, conceptualization were to have a clear aspect,

original: de'i tshe nyams pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: then what is the loss if it is like that?

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rmi lam na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rmi lam na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Conceptualization is like that even in a dream.

original: 'on te rmi lam du mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na /ğŸ”½nyams su myong ba dran pa yi //
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam du mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na / nyams su myong ba dran pa yi //
translated: But if it is not the case that conceptualization in a dream has a clear aspect,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: then how is it that one remembers it?

original: med pa'i dngos po ni dang gi ngo bo nyid med pa des na /
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po ni dang gi ngo bo nyid med pa des na /
translated: A thing that does not exist, i.e., that does not have the nature of an entity,

original: de 'dzin pa la shes pa la ci zhig snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa la shes pa la ci zhig snang bar 'gyur /
translated: how could it appear to the cognition that apprehends it?

original: 'o na khyed kyi lugs kyi rnal 'byor pa 'das pa la sogs pa rig par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyi lugs kyi rnal 'byor pa 'das pa la sogs pa rig par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how is it that in your system the yogi knows the past, etc.?

original: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The yogi knows the past, etc.

original: 'on te zad pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zad pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if the past, etc., exist,

original: des na de dag 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /ğŸ”½mi gtsang ba la sogs pa @235a * //
analyzed: des na de dag 'dzin pa yin no zhe na / mi gtsang ba la sogs pa @235a * //
translated: then how is it that they are apprehended?ğŸ”½The past, etc., are like

original: ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: impure things, etc.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: â€œOrâ€ is a hypothetical.

original: bsgoms pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œMerely through meditationâ€ is stated.

original: rigs pa'i mtshan nyid sems de las byung ba de'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i mtshan nyid sems de las byung ba de'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of reasoning is the cognition of the nature of that which arises from the mind.

original: tshad ma yin la de dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma yin la de dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is valid cognition, and one who possesses it is a yogi. This means possessing that cognition.

original: zhi gnas te zhi bar gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhag mthong ste shes rab de gnyis dang ldan pas gzugs gang yin pa de nyid 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas te zhi bar gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhag mthong ste shes rab de gnyis dang ldan pas gzugs gang yin pa de nyid 'brel pa ste /
translated: Having tranquility, the samadhi of peaceful abiding, and insight, wisdom, possessing those two, whatever form there is, that itself is the path of engagement,

original: mtshungs par 'jug pa'i lam de'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par 'jug pa'i lam de'o //
translated: the path of similar engagement.

original: gal te 'byol yang zad par chu la sogs pa snang ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byol yang zad par chu la sogs pa snang ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one wanders, isnâ€™t it just the appearance of water and so on that is exhausted?

original: de la gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œIn that caseâ€ is stated.

original: 'di dag ces bya bar zad par sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya bar zad par sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œTheseâ€ refers to the exhaustion of earth and so on.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba tsam gyis so //
translated: â€œBy that aloneâ€ means by mere appearance.

original: gal te snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, â€œDoes it appear?â€

original: de tsam gyis de kho nar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de kho nar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that by that alone it would be reality,

original: snang ba tsam gyis zhes smras so //
analyzed: snang ba tsam gyis zhes smras so //
translated: merely appearing.

original: gal te brtag bzod pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te brtag bzod pa ma yin mod /
translated: If it is not able to withstand investigation,

original: de lta na yang re zhig de bsgoms pas ni gsal bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig de bsgoms pas ni gsal bar byed pa yin la /
translated: then even so, it is still the case that it is clarified by meditation on it.

original: bsgoms pas gsal bar byas pa ni de kho na ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'thad pa yang ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas gsal bar byas pa ni de kho na ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'thad pa yang ma yin no snyam na /
translated: And it is not tenable that what is clarified by meditation is not the nature of reality.

original: rtog pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, â€œmere conceptualization.â€

original: 'o na bsgoms pa ni de kho na rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na bsgoms pa ni de kho na rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, meditation would not be the cause of understanding reality.

original: des na skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa gsal bar byas pa yang de kho na ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa gsal bar byas pa yang de kho na ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And so, even though momentariness and so on are clarified, they would not be reality.

original: tshad ma'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, â€œvalid cognition.â€

original: de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: â€œIt is like thatâ€ means that it is the cause of understanding reality.

original: dngos po'i sgo nas rtogs par 'thad na ni de kho na nges par te /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgo nas rtogs par 'thad na ni de kho na nges par te /
translated: If it is tenable that it is understood by way of the thing itself, then it is ascertained as reality.

original: gtan la phebs par 'dod pa'i yin no //
analyzed: gtan la phebs par 'dod pa'i yin no //
translated: It is held to be established.

original: gal te med pa ni sus kyang bsgom pa nyid du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te med pa ni sus kyang bsgom pa nyid du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is nonexistent, then no one can make it an object of meditation.

original: des na de gsal ba nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na de gsal ba nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be clear?

original: yod pa 'ba' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'ba' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Only that which exists is clear.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni med pa yang ngo //
translated: Moreover, means also that which does not exist.

original: gsal ba dang mi rtog pa'i blo'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi rtog pa'i blo'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which has the result of a clear and non-conceptual mind is called that.

original: gzhan du 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i shes pa'i rgyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i shes pa'i rgyur ro //
translated: That which is transformed means that which is the cause of an unclear consciousness.

original: slu ba med pa can gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid mngon sum yin no zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: slu ba med pa can gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid mngon sum yin no zhes 'brel te /
translated: That which is non-deceptive is the direct perception of the subject.

original: yul de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: sngar spyad ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar spyad ces sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with what was previously experienced.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul can ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul can ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The subject of desire and so on is

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: that which has the sign of an object of desire and so on as its object. That is not valid cognition.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul can no //
translated: That means the subject of desire and so on.

original: de dag gi @235b shes pa ni bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa nyid ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: de dag gi @235b shes pa ni bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa nyid ma yin snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that their consciousness is not born from the power of meditation,

original: de dag la yang zhes smras te /
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes smras te /
translated: They also, i.e., the heterodox,

original: mu stegs pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: have such imaginations.

original: gal te de dag gis rang gi lugs kyi brtags pa de dag ma bsgoms pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag gis rang gi lugs kyi brtags pa de dag ma bsgoms pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they do not cultivate those imaginations of their own system,

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi thun mong ba'i don nyid rjes su ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi thun mong ba'i don nyid rjes su ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then they do not express the meaning that is common to the world.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'i don gang yin pa de 'ga' zhig kho na la yod pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa de ci rigs pa las 'da' bar gnas pa ma yin nam ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'i don gang yin pa de 'ga' zhig kho na la yod pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa gang yin pa de ci rigs pa las 'da' bar gnas pa ma yin nam ste /
translated: Thus, what is the meaning that is common to the world? It is that which exists for some, but not for others. Is this certainty not a violation of reason?

original: 'das pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a violation, is the meaning.

original: gal te de dag gi don de bsgoms pa las gyur pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'jig rten dang thun mong kho na yin na de'i tshe thams cad kyis ci'i phyir ma dmigs zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi don de bsgoms pa las gyur pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'jig rten dang thun mong kho na yin na de'i tshe thams cad kyis ci'i phyir ma dmigs zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: If that meaning is not due to their cultivation, but is rather common to the world, then why is it not perceived by everyone?

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor rnams kyis so //
translated: They, i.e., the yogis,

original: de'i tshig la ni rnal 'byor pa'i tshig la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshig la ni rnal 'byor pa'i tshig la'o //
translated: The word their refers to the words of the yogis.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i tshig la'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i tshig la'o //
translated: The word others refers to the words of ÄªÅ›vara and so on.

original: 'di la bram zer brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bram zer brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word if is the Brahmin's statement.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i tshad mas so //ğŸ”½yul mtshungs la zhes bya ba ni yul gang la dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa de nyid la gal te skyes bu'i tshad ma yang 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i tshad mas so // yul mtshungs la zhes bya ba ni yul gang la dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa de nyid la gal te skyes bu'i tshad ma yang 'jug pa yin na /
translated: The word that refers to the valid knowledge of persons.

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If the valid knowledge of persons also engages the same object that is the domain of the valid knowledge that is the subject of the imperceptible, then it would be the case that they are related as that which is invalidated and that which invalidates. But that is not the case.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the one who holds the tenets states:

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even the consciousness of the yogi.

original: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can de'i tshig gi rgyu gang yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de shes pa de la gnod pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis bstan pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: shin tu dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can de'i tshig gi rgyu gang yin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de shes pa de la gnod pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis bstan pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The nature of the consciousness that is the cause of those words, which is the subject that is beyond the senses, is indeed impaired by that knowledge. This is what is taught by the speech of the TathÄgata.

original: ji ltar zhes dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma de dag gi /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma de dag gi /
translated: How? The valid cognitions that are beyond the senses

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dag dang 'gal ba rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ni bzlog pa la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma de dag gnod pa de bzhin du de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: This is the same for the opposite case as well. Just as the speech of the TathÄgata impairs those valid cognitions that are beyond the senses, in the same way, those valid cognitions would impair the speech of the TathÄgata.

analyzed: cig shos bdag cag la sogs pa lta bu rnams kyis gcad par te / nges par nus pa don gang yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //

original: dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ni /

original: don 'di yin te /
